info.description: How well do you know "NCIS"? Take this quiz to prove how big of a fan you really are!
info.name: "NCIS": How Much Do You Know? Part 1 Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: In Agent McGee's book "Deep Six", two of the characters very much resemble Tony and Ziva. Prove you're a super fan and name these two book characters.

response.info: After a psycho started killing off the real life inspirations of the characters in his book, McGee was forced to admit the truth.

questions.text: Who does Jethro always take out to dinner for their birthday?

response.info: He always takes Abby out to dinner for her birthday. In one particular episode, she was quit distraught, assuming that Jethro had forgotten about her birthday because he was busy working a case. After being very short with Jethro for most of the day, Abby realized that Jethro had some how managed to slip past her and leave a gift on her desk! Jethro loves using those sneaky sniper skills he has!

questions.text: What is the nickname of the Bravo 51 sniper rifle that was used by Ari when he was trying to kill the female members of Gibbs' team?
Director Vance seems to have an established relationship with Ziva's father. What is her father's first name?

response.info: Eli is an appropriate name for the leader of Mossad. The name Eli means "ascension" in Hebrew. By the way, the name Ziva means "splendid" in Hebrew.

questions.text: When Ziva attempts to rejoin the team after being rescued from Africa by Gibbs, McGee, and DiNozzo, what gift does she give to Gibbs in his basement?

response.info: Ziva knows that Gibbs doesn't use power tools when he builds boats. For this reason a skill saw and power sander are out of the question, and Jethro doesn't need a lathe to build a boat. Jethro accepts the gift, but later questions Ziva about her true intentions for wanting to rejoin the team.

questions.text: If you've taken the other "NCIS" quizzes, you know that Abby's biggest pet peeve involves people that eat chicken but claim to be vegetarian. Only super fans know that this is Abby's second biggest pet peeve!

answers.text: people that use bumpers when bowling
answers.value: people that use bumpers when bowling

answers.text: agents that forget to sign the chain of evidence slips
answers.value: agents that forget to sign the chain of evidence slips

response.info: While Abby and McGee were going through some evidence that the police had given them regarding a case, Abby asks McGee if he knows what her biggest pet peeve is. He tells her, "people who claim to be vegetarians but eat chicken?" Surprised he remembered, Abby asks him if he knows her second biggest pet peeve. McGee then replies, "mishandled evidence." Pleasantly surprised, Abby then proceeds to rant about what is wrong with the evidence they received.

questions.text: When McGee gets poison ivy, Gibbs gives him the recipe for a handy remedy. One of the ingredients is white vinegar. What is the other ingredient?

response.info: After some translation back into normal terms, McGee discovers the ingredients are the same as the ones Gibbs recommended. Unlike Gibbs, Abby is nice enough to mix him up a batch!

questions.text: What piece of jewelry does Ziva always wear?
As most fans know, especially the males, Abby has a large tattoo across her back. What is this tattoo of?

response.info: In the opening credits, one of the clips shows Abby with her back to the camera changing shirts. This shot clearly shows the huge tattoo of a cross on her back. I believe you can also see the cross during the earlier Halloween episode when Abby is dressed as Marilyn Monroe.

questions.text: Agent Gibbs: "I don't believe in ________!"

response.info: Gibbs has been married four times, so he obviously believes in the notion of marriage. The way he talks about his last three wives, he most certainly believes in divorce. When he has flashbacks of his wife and daughter you can be very certain that he loved them. As any of his team could tell you, he 100% does not believe in coincidences!

info.description: The follow-up show to "JAG" and a cousin of the "CSI" shows, "Navy Criminal Investigative Services" is sure to captivate.
info.name: "NCIS - Naval Criminal Investigative Services" Quiz
info.author: BigDaddyPanda

questions.text: Gibbs is the leader of the team. What is his first name?

response.info: His full name is Leroy Jethro Gibbs and he is played by Mark Harmon.

questions.text: In the first 2 seasons, Agent Kate Todd worked with NCIS. What organization did she work to just prior to joining them?

response.info: The first episode has an officer dying on Air Force One. After the case is solved, Gibbs offers her a job.

questions.text: How did Agent Todd leave NCIS?
Agent Gibbs was a Marine before joining NCIS. What was his rank?

response.info: He was a sniper (before joining)  who joined after the murder of his wife and daughter.

questions.text: What is Dr. Mallard's nickname?

response.info: Mallard - a duck, get it? Ducky is played by David McCallum, who formerly starred on "The Man From U.N.C.L.E."

questions.text: Agent Dinozzo worked with the police force in which city before joining up?

response.info: He worked homicide.

questions.text: What is Agent Dinozzo's nickname for Agent McGee?

response.info: Probie is short for probationary, McGee was low man on the team.

questions.text: In season 3, Officer David joins NCIS from what overseas group?
Which team member graduated from M.I.T.?

response.info: His speciality was computers. The actor who plays him, Sean Murray, enjoys building computers.

questions.text: In season 3, "NCIS" gets a new director. What actress of both film and TV takes on this role?

response.info: "Dumb and Dumber" and "Any Given Sunday" are among her film credits. Her many TV roles are highlighted by "Picket Fences" and "Chicago Hope".

info.description: This quiz involves the small details that are both observed and mentioned throughout the series!
info.name: "NCIS": Do You Remember? Trivia Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: What is Abby's favorite type of flower?

response.info: Abby received black roses for her birthday from most of Gibbs' team!

questions.text: What was the name of the first wife of Agent Gibbs?

response.info: She was Jethro's first wife. While Jethro was away on duty, she witnessed a murder. Just before she was to testify against the murderer, the NIS agent assigned to guard her was shot while driving them. The car crashed as a result and killed Shannon and their daughter.

questions.text: The sub-plot of one episode shows Abby fanatically searching for the person who stole a cupcake that was given to her by Ziva. Which person admitted to being the cupcake thief?
By what method does Dr. Mallard typically establish a time of death for his patients?

response.info: The liver probe is used to measure the internal body temperature of the victim. After this measurement is obtained, it is used in an algebraic equation such as the Glaister equation to predict a time of death.

questions.text: Which of the following does Dr. Mallard commonly find on victims of hanging, strangulation, or asphyxia?

response.info: According to enotes.com, "Petechial hemorrhages occur when blood leaks from the tiny capillaries in the eyes, which can rupture due to increased pressure on the veins in the head when the airways are obstructed." Arterial hemorrhage is bleeding from an artery. Cerebral hemorrhage is bleeding in the brain. Reactionary hemorrhage is bleeding that occurs as a result of a particular disease or disorder.

questions.text: Agent Gibbs has an obvious fascination with what type of woman?

response.info: All four of his wives and Director Shepard were redheads. The only time he apparently deviated from this pattern was his relationship with Colonel Mann, who was a blonde.

questions.text: Agent Gibbs was formerly a Marine sniper. What substance did he coat his bullets with?

response.info: When Gibbs and Abby were discussing details about the gun that was used to kill Kate, Gibbs mentioned that the bullets he used as a sniper were "moly" coated. Technically, the bullets he used were .308 moly coated boat tail full metal jacket rounds.

questions.text: Most of the bombs that are shown on "NCIS" are made of what type of explosive?
On "NCIS" by what other name is a toilet or bathroom known as?

response.info: The Army calls it a latrine, while the Navy and Marines call it the head. In the days of wind powered vessels, the toilets were placed at the front, or head, of the ship. This prevented odors from being carried across the rest of the ship by wind currents. Being that this tradition started on ships, it seems fitting that they are called heads by the Navy and Marines, but not by the Army.

questions.text: What does DiNozzo mean when he tells Gibbs "On your 6 Boss!"?

response.info: Marines use clock positions to describe locations. 12 o'clock is directly ahead, 3 o'clock is directly to the right, 6 o'clock is directly behind you, and 9 o'clock is directly to the left.

questions.text: In the episode "SWAK", Tony is exposed to the Yersinia Pestis bacteria. As a result, he contracts the plague. Which form of the plague did Tony contract?

response.info: As the name sounds, pneumonic plague attacks the lungs while bubonic and septicemic plague attack the lymphatic system and the blood respectively. I just made up renal plague. All three forms of the plague are caused by the Yersinia pestis bacteria and all three can typically be treated with antibiotics such as streptomycin or gentamycin.

questions.text: During the first season of the series, what title was used for the show?

response.info:
During the first season, the series aired under the title "Navy NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service".  Starting with the second season, the title was shortened to "NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service".  The producers of the series felt that having the name "Navy" in the title would be redundant, as the title would then be "Navy Naval Criminal Investigative Service".
The premise and characters of "Navy NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service" was first introduced in two one hour episodes on the hit television series "JAG" (1995).
In the "JAG" episodes "Ice Queen" and "Meltdown", NCIS was brought in to investigate the murder of JAG Officer Lt. Loren Singer.
The two "JAG" episodes were later edited into a single hour long episode, and  broadcast as the pilot for the new series under the name "Navy NCIS: The Beginning".  That episode aired on October 21, 2003, nearly a month after the first episode of the series "Yankee White" was aired on September 23, 2003.

After being assigned to lead a Major Crimes Response Team (MCRT), who was the first member of the unit to be hired by Gibbs?

response.info:
Gibbs hired Tony DiNozzo, who had just completed his service as a homicide detective for the Baltimore Police Department.  Prior to being hired by NCIS, DiNozzo had been somewhat of a "law enforcement nomad", having served 2 years with the Peoria Police Department in Illinois, 18 months with the Philadelphia Police Department in Pennsylvania, and 22 months in Maryland with Baltimore Police Department.
Both Chief Medical Examiner Dr. Donald Mallard and Forensic Specialist Abby Sciuto were already employed with NCIS, and Gibbs hired former U.S. Secret Service Agent Caitlin Todd at the end of the season one episode "Yankee White".

questions.text: Only one of the characters on "NCIS" is left handed. Which character is it?

response.info: McGee is the only left handed character. Historically, some of the world's greatest minds, particularly in math and science, have been left handed. This is an appropriate trait for McGee. It is thought that people that are left handed are right brained, meaning that fields such as math, science, and engineering seem to come easier. Ben Franklin, Thomas Edison, Isaac Newton, Albert Einstein, Linus Pauling, and Marie Curie are just a few examples of famous left handed scientists. Just as a note, Gibbs was shown writing with his left hand in one episode, but has used his right hand on every other occasion.

questions.text: In the episode "Silver War", Director Shepard uses one of Jethro's rules against him. She told him, "It's better to seek forgiveness than ____

response.info: When he asks Director Shepard why she hadn't told him about hiring Ziva, she busts him with one of his own rules! Rule # 18: It's better to seek forgiveness than ask permission. The director knew that if she asked Jethro about Ziva he'd say put her on a different team or don't hire her at all.

questions.text: Abby has 3 undergraduate degrees from what SEC school?

response.info: Abby has a B.S. in Sociology, Psychology, and Criminology from LSU. She also has a Masters in Criminology and Forensic Science from Georgia State University. Smart and cute!

questions.text: Gibbs hates being addressed by what title?
What is Jethro's liquor of choice?

response.info: Scotch was the drink of choice of Jasper Shepard, the deceased father of Director Shepard. Whiskey is close, but technically it is bourbon that Jethro drinks most often. Though bourbon is his liquor of choice, he drinks beer when he's in Mexico with Mike Franks, and has shared a beer with Colonel Mann in his basement on a couple of occasions.

questions.text: Ziva is always well armed. She carries her issued firearm, a back-up firearm, and a knife. Her main gun is worn on her hip. Where does she keep her back-up firearm holstered?

response.info: When she first starts to work for Gibbs, he makes her simply observe the first few investigations. In order to make sure she simply observes, Gibbs takes away her gun. He then asks for her back-up. She pretended not to have one, but Gibbs knew she had a holster on her left ankle. Though he took both of her guns, he let her keep her knife. According to Gibbs, you should never go anywhere without a knife.

According to Abby, what does cyanide gas smell like?

response.info: In the episode "Bloodbath", several attempts were made to kill Abby. In one attempt, the evidence that the killer knew she would be examining was tampered with. When Abby started her analysis, the chemical she added trigger a reaction that caused the release of cyanide gas into her lab. Thankfully, she noticed the smell of almonds. Abby and McGee then ran out of the lab and enable the biohazard lock on the door to seal the lab and prevent the rest of the building from being contaminated.

questions.text: In the beginning of the episode "Doppelganger", what service is the telemarketer trying to sell to the Petty Officer?

response.info: The telemarketer worked for "Thrifty Phone Service". Gibbs and his team used the recorded telemarketer's conversation to figure out that the sounds of murder heard by the telemarketer were actually sound effects from the Petty Officer's computer. From this they found out that the Petty Officer faked his own death.

questions.text: Speaking of the episode "Agent Afloat", what was the name of the air craft carrier that Tony was stationed on?
What antibiotic is mentioned in "NCIS" to be treatment for anthrax exposure?

response.info: Abby mentions this to the team as they investigate a double murder on a Navy aircraft carrier. Inhalation anthrax is caused by the Bacillus anthracis spore. Though Cipro is the antibiotic of choice for anthrax treatment, the CDC recommends combining this treatment with the anthrax vaccine. Just as a note, doxycycline and levofloxacin can also be used to treat anthrax exposure.

questions.text: What does Director Vance typically chew on, especially when nervous or irritated?

response.info: When Director Vance filled in for Director Shepard for several weeks, he left several chewed toothpicks and wrappers on the desk. This was quite irritating to Director Shepard.

questions.text: Introduced in season one, for whom did the character Caitlin Todd work, before she started at "NCIS"?

response.info: Sasha Alexander played the character Caitlin Todd for the first two seasons of the show. An ex-Secret Service agent who worked protection detail for the President, Caitlin was killed at the end of the second season as Alexander wished to leave the show.

questions.text: What breed of dogs does Ducky's mother own?

response.info: Mrs. Mallard, who was suffering from dementia, shared her home with multiple corgis. She was well-traveled, and loved to speak of the past. She passes away in 2010 but her son keeps it a secret for a while.

answers.text: Kills a highjacker aboard the Concorde
answers.value: Kills a highjacker aboard the Concorde

response.info: McGee writes a novel entitled "Deep Six". It becomes a best-seller, but infuriates his coworkers, as the characters in his novel are based on them. For a short period of time after his literary success he puts on airs, such as pretending to smoke a pipe.

questions.text: What is unusual about Abby's stuffed animal that she has named Bert?

answers.value: It is a purple teddy bear with a top hat

response.info: Abby, the forensics specialist on the show, is often shown hugging Bert, her stuffed hippo that farts when squeezed. Abby is a genius who often sports pigtails dresses in Gothic clothing. She shares a very close relationship with Agent McGee.

questions.text: What is the name of Gibbs' hometown?

response.info: Special Agent Gibbs is from the small town of Stillwater, Pennsylvania. His father, played by actor Ralph Waite, lives there throughout the show. It is possible that the name is a reference Gibbs' character and to the old saying "Still waters run deep".

questions.text: In which country was Ziva David born?

response.info: Ziva is a Mossad agent who takes the place of Caitlin Todd after she is killed at the end of season 2. She is highly skilled in defensive tactics, is multilingual, and haunted by demons from her past. She intimidates both DiNozzo and McGee. She was born and raised in Israel before becoming a U.S. citizen.

questions.text: What kind of vehicle does Dr. Mallard drive in "NCIS"?
Gibbs is a lifelong bachelor and womanizer.

response.info: It is revealed early in season 1, that Gibbs has been divorced three times. It is not until later in the program that the audience finds out that he was actually married a fourth time, when he was very young, and his wife Shannon and daughter Kelly were murdered by a drug lord after they witnessed a murder. Their deaths haunt Gibbs throughout the show.

questions.text: Agent Anthony DiNozzo is assassinated by Mike Franks in season 3.

response.info: Anthony DiNozzo is one of only three characters to appear in every episode of of the first ten seasons. Played by actor Michael Weatherly, DiNozzo is portrayed as a playboy with lots of inner demons. He is a brave, tough, and possibly narcissistic agent, who is a little boy at heart.

questions.text: Before we get started on "NCIS," here's a little background. "NCIS" was created by Donald Bellisario. The series is unique but the idea didn't come from thin air. It was a spin-off of what other creation by Donald Bellisario?

response.info: "Judge Advocate General," or "J.A.G," was also created by Donald Bellisario. "NCIS" was created as a spin-off of "J.A.G," and a few lawyers from the show appear on "NCIS." The first time we see the crew from "NCIS" was actually in a couple episodes of "J.A.G."

questions.text: This character's first appearance in "NCIS" was in the first season episode "Sub Rosa." He is often picked on by Agent DiNozzo in many ways, including nicknames like "Probie." Who is this Special Agent?

response.info: Agent McGee joins "NCIS" on a regular basis in the second season. He is often the object of many jokes and nicknames from Tony DiNozzo. His most frequent name, "Probie," is a naval term for Probationary Agent. Even Agent Gibbs gets called Probie!

questions.text: So now that you know about Agent McGee, where did he go to college for his undergraduate and graduate degrees?
Let's move on to Special Agent Anthony DiNozzo Jr. Tony joined NCIS after his tenure in Baltimore as a homicide detective. Tony majored in Physical Education at what Big Ten university?

response.info: Tony is the son of a formerly wealthy businessman - Tony DiNozzo Sr. His father ultimately squanders his wealth on fast cars, loose women and living high on life. Tony is just as promiscuous as his father and also shares his father's taste in expensive clothing.

questions.text: We're now going to move onto everyone's favorite forensic scientist, Abby Sciuto. Abby was born in the state of Louisiana and attended LSU. Growing up, she had to adapt to her parents' physical impairment. What was their impairment?

response.info: In many of the episodes of "NCIS," Abby and Agent Gibbs often communicate through sign language for fun.  In one episode in particular, Gibbs mentions to DiNozzo that Abby learned American Sign Language growing up because both of her parents were deaf.

questions.text: The NCIS medical examiner, Dr. Donald Mallard, "Ducky," is a vital part of the team. What country is Dr. Mallard from?

answers.hint: (One Word - not United Kingdom or Great Britain)

response.info: Ducky often refers to his homeland of Scotland and his alma mater. He often goes off onto a rambling tangent while discussing a case or an autopsy, which of course, annoys Agent Gibbs.

questions.text: Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs is the no-nonsense boss seen at NCIS. Jethro was born in the town of Stillwater. In which state was he born?

response.info: Stillwater is a small Pennsylvania town where everyone knows the other. Jackson Gibbs is his father, and owns the general store in Stillwater. Jethro met his first wife, Shannon, in Stillwater. They first talkedgeneral to each other at the Stillwater train station.

questions.text: This character first appeared in the first season by infiltrating autopsy and taking Dr. Mallard and his assistant hostage. His last appearance was in the two-part season 3 premier where he was killed by Ziva David.
After the death of Director Jenny Shepherd, Leon Vance took over as the new NCIS director. Jenny Shepherd was not the first NCIS director known about. Who was?

response.info: Alan Dale plays Director Tom Morrow in the earliest episodes of NCIS. With the death of Agent Todd at the hands of Ari Haswari, Director Morrow tendered his resignation to accept the Deputy Director's position at Homeland Security. Jenny Shepherd, played by Lauren Holly, took over after Morrow resigned.

questions.text: Dr. Mallard has had several assistants in his tenure at NCIS. Jimmy Palmer replaced Ducky's first assistant who was forced into rehabilitation after being shot in the shoulder by Ari Haswari. What was Ducky's first assistant's name?

response.info: Gerald was Ducky's first assistant before being shot. Ducky had a temporary aide before hiring Jimmy Palmer as his full time aide. Gerald Jackson was played by Pancho Demmings, and Jimmy Palmer was played by Brian Dietzen.

info.description: I will not lie; I am a total television junkie. "NCIS" is one of my favourites because the stories are interesting and the characters are positively phenomenal. If you've been enjoying it as obsessively as I have, you'll probably ace this quiz.
info.name: Some Details You May Have Missed Quiz
info.author: candycane4114

questions.text: The team is often much like a very dysfunctional family, with Gibbs and Director Shepard as the parents, DiNozzo, McGee, Ziva/Kate, and Abby as the children, and Ducky as some sort of more distant relative, like a Scottish uncle or grandfather. We all know parents aren't supposed to show favouritism, but it's stated in multiple episodes that this person is Gibbs' favourite.

response.info: Even if you haven't seen the episodes in which either Gibbs or Abby state it, you could probably figure it out from the attitude; Gibbs kisses Abs on the cheek, brings her Caf-Pow, and takes her out to dinner every year for her birthday while he head slaps all the others on the team (except Kate, I believe).

questions.text: Tony DiNozzo has a lot of nicknames for Tim McGee, the junior agent on the team. McCranky, McDetail, McEgghead, McFlabby, McFlowerPower, McFreaky, McGarnagle, McGecko, McGeek, McGiggles, McGnome, McGoo, McGoogle, and the ever-popular Probie, to name just a few. Which of the following was McGee never called in seasons 1 through 7?

response.info: DiNozzo does make a lot of references to McGee's online gaming, where his avatar is an Elf Lord, and he catches a lot of flak from all of the team members for it, but he has never been called McGamer and since the number of times DiNozzo calls him by nickname is winding down, I doubt he ever will.

questions.text: Tony comes from a very interesting family. He is an only child, and his parents were wealthy, although he was cut off for unknown reasons. Gregarious and movie-savvy, he has stated that he was given vampire nightmares as a child during a phase his mother went through named after this monarch.

Tim McGee sometimes seems out of place in the squad room; he's a computer genius rather than a streetsmart ex-cop, assassin, or Marine and least at ease with playing the gun-toting tough-guy federal agent. He also has an interesting hobby/moonlight career as a novelist. Everybody knows his first novel was called "Deep Six" but what was his second novel entitled?

answers.text: Deep Six: The Continuing Adventures of L.J. Tibbs
answers.value: Deep Six: The Continuing Adventures of L.J. Tibbs

response.info: Interestingly enough, the exposed cover of Tim's first published book reveals that "Deep Six: The Continuing Adventures of L.J. Tibbs" is volume five, begging the question, which were the first four volumes?

questions.text: Mossad officer Ziva David joined NCIS as a liaison after she shot her half-brother and rogue Mossad agent Ari Haswari, saving Gibbs' life. Her father is the deputy director of Mossad and Ziva, like Ari, was groomed by him from childhood for a specific purpose. How many languages (not including the language of love) does Ziva speak?

response.info: Ziva remembers having fun as a child in the forests of Israel; her father would carry her in blindfolded to find her way out on her own. In spite of this molding, Ziva claims she was not recruited to Mossad but volunteered after serving her required two-year stint in the Israeli army.

questions.text: There really is no-one like forensic specialist Abby Sciuto; as Tony has said, she's "a paradox wrapped in an oxymoron smothered in contradictions in terms. Sleeps in a coffin. Really, the happiest goth you'll ever meet." Despite her eccentric tendencies, she is all about the science. She graduated from Louisiana State University with a triple major in these three fields.

response.info: She also has a younger brother, but it is never said whether he is also deaf.

questions.text: Dr. Donald Mallard is known to nearly everybody as Ducky, for obvious reasons. He attended the University of Edinburgh in his native Scotland before working all over the world for various agencies. In "Bikini Wax" he tells Palmer that he did not always want to be a pathologist; which vocation did he briefly consider taking up?

response.info: He says he eventually decided against teaching at his alum because he couldn't picture himself giving long, rambling lectures... It is ironic that such an observant and intuitive man does not recognize his own verbosity.

questions.text: Jimmy Palmer, "the autopsy gremlin" as Tony calls him, has been a comic sideline character since Ducky's first assistant Gerald lost the full use of one of his arms after Ari Haswari shot him. It's implied that the character based on him in McGee's book has necrophilia, but in "real" life, Palmer has this quirk.

Now, finally, we can get to everybody's favourite-- Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs. Terse and nearly infallible, he's the end-all, be-all of NCIS agents we've seen. In "Under Covers" Abby wishes him a happy birthday on 10 November, but what is his astrological sign as mentioned in another episode?

response.info:
Gibbs mentions this in "Blowback" and places his birthday (probably) between 23 August and 22 September, which does not correspond with when Abby says his birthday is. This, however, is explained by the birthday of the Marine Corps, which is 10 November, and correlates both with his extremely personal personal life (his team would most likely not know his real birthday) and with his statements that Marines are for life and others which indicate his very high opinion of the corps.

Gibbs was a Marine Scout Sniper during the First Gulf War and although he is no longer on active duty, he was mentioned in "Ice Queen" (JAG) to be a reservist.

questions.text: We also know Gibbs has had a lot of relationships over the years, but the only truly serious one was with his first wife, Shannon. Besides her, he was married and divorced three times and had relationships with Director Shepard, Colonel Mann, Rose, and the mysterious redheaded woman from the first couple of seasons. All of these probably contributed to his grey hairs, which leads people to believe he is older than he really is. Gibbs' real age has never been revealed but we do know what year he left his hometown of Stillwater, Pennsylvania for the Corps; which was it?

response.info: In the flashback in "Heartland" we see Gibbs (played by Mark Harmon's son) waiting at the train station in his uniform, where he meets Shannon. He looks very young, about eighteen to twenty, and from this we can estimate he was born circa 1956-1958 which means in season 1 (2002) he would have been 46 or older. Of course this is all academic; I doubt we'll ever know the whole truth about Gibbs but that's part of his and "NCIS"'s charm.

questions.text: What type of car does Abby regularly drive in the first season?

response.info: When Gibbs was in the hospital in his second coma, Abby came to visit. While Abby was begging the charge nurse to let her in to see Jethro, she mentions that her hearse broke down. That comment along with the strange items that the nurse saw in Abby's purse very quickly gained her access to Jethro's room.

questions.text: When Gibbs wants to leave the evidence garage and go back to one of the other floors in the building, what type of ID must he show to be able to get in the elevator?

response.info: Gibbs leans down to a device next to the elevator. This device uses an infrared light to map the pattern of blood vessels in the retina of the eye. The scanned pattern is then compared to a database of the patterns that belong to all of the people that have access to the building. If the scans match, the person is allowed access. Just as no two people have the same fingerprint, no two people have the same retinal pattern. Bad guys have become fairly good at faking fingerprints, but it is incredibly hard to fake a retinal pattern!

questions.text: After her failed relationship with Agent Gibbs, where does Lt. Col. Mann go to retire?
Agent McGee is very well educated. He graduated from both M.I.T. and what other prestigious school?

response.info: How proud McGee's parents must be! He has a B.S. in Biomechanical Engineering from Johns Hopkins University. This field merges the disciplines of engineering and medicine, and overlaps numerous areas of the forensic science field.

questions.text: Which of the following correctly describes McGee's M.I.T. degree?

response.info: He has a Masters in Computer Forensics from M.I.T. This extensive knowledge base is the main reason that Gibbs often has McGee helping Abby hack computers, crack encryptions, and process evidence. Face it, it takes one heck of a computer geek to hack into the CIA!

questions.text: Since we're on the subject of education, what type of college degree does DiNozzo have?

response.info: DiNozzo has mentioned this fact several times during the series. On one such occasion, DiNozzo was in the forensics lab listening to Abby and McGee's high tech explanation of something that was on the plasma screen. He interrupts their techno babble by saying, "Hey! Phys Ed major here!"

questions.text: What language, other than English, does McGee speak fairly well?

response.info: During one of the Halloween episodes, the team crashes a costume party looking for a suspect. They find the suspect dressed as a Klingon. (For all of the non-sci-fi fans out there, Klingons are one of the most prevalent alien species in the Star Trek universe.) During their first several questions, the suspect answered the team in the Klingon language. McGee was nice enough to translate what he said back into English for Gibbs. Poor McGee, as if Tony didn't have enough to make fun of him for already! Just for the record, during the series, McGee has proven himself to be fluent in Pig Latin as well!

questions.text: We all know that Gibbs has many rules. Fill in the blank space of this rule: Always be ______ when you lie.

During one episode, Agent Gibbs' fourth wife, Stephanie Flynn, was an initial suspect in an investigation. (An investigation Gibbs happened to be working jointly with Lt. Col. Mann.) Towards the end of the episode she is cleared of involvement, but later meets Jethro in his basement to return something to him. What did she return to him?

answers.text: his copy of their divorce papers
answers.value: his copy of their divorce papers

response.info: Stephanie returned Jethro's dog tags. She said that she found them in a drawer. Jethro accepts them, thinking that he had lost them years ago.

questions.text: Gibbs has always felt that apologies are a sign of weakness. When talking to Ducky after coming out of retirement, Gibbs mentions that there is one occasion in which apologizing is okay. According to Gibbs, who is okay to apologize to?

response.info: At Kate's funeral, Jethro did say he was sorry to her. This is one of the very few times we hear Jethro apologize. Even though he said it, he never explicitly mentions it being okay to apologize to a dead person.

questions.text: Who likes to drink coffee a lot?

response.info: Lauren Holly plays Jenny, the 2nd NCIS director after Alan Dale and before Rocky Carroll.

questions.text: What is the name of the agent who replaces Kate Todd?

response.info: After Kate gets shot by Ari, his sister (Ziva David) replaces her.

questions.text: What is the nickname of the doctor?

questions.text: What is the name of the person who kills Kate?

response.info: Ari kills Kate in the episode "Twilight". When he is aiming to shoot Gibbs, Kate takes the bullet, but survives thanks to her bullet proof vest. Seconds later, Ari aims again and Kate gets hit in the head.

questions.text: Who does Tony call "Probie"?
In total, how many NCIS directors were there between seasons 1 through 3?

response.info: The first director was Thomas Morrow, portrayed by Alan Dale. The second is Jennifer Shepard, portrayed by Lauren Holly. Rocky Carroll, as Leon Vance, takes Jennifer Shepard's place in season 5.

questions.text: In the episode "Kill Ari", is Kate dead?

response.info: In "Kill Ari", the team deals with the aftermath of her death.

questions.text: What did Jenny ask Jethro when he found out she was the new NCIS director?

response.correct: If he would have a problem taking orders from her
response.info: She later clarified if he would have a problem taking orders from her as Director or as a woman. Gibbs said he didn't have a problem with either.

questions.text: Where in the world did Jenny and Jethro work while partners?

response.info: Gibbs also lived in Moscow with his then-wife Stephanie.

questions.text: How did Jenny once respond when asked if she was one of Gibbs's ex-wives?
What did Mike Franks allude to that made Gibbs come back to NCIS after he 'retired' and went to Mexico?

answers.text: Gibbs didn't think Jenny could take care of herself.
answers.value: Gibbs didn't think Jenny could take care of herself.

answers.value: Gibbs didn't think Jenny could do a good job as director without him.

answers.text: Gibbs didn't like how Jenny made DiNozzo in charge.
answers.value: Gibbs didn't like how Jenny made DiNozzo in charge.

response.info: When Jenny and Mike Franks were waiting at the diner in "Judgment Day", Jenny mentioned she didn't think that Gibbs still had feelings for her. Franks then responded that he and Gibbs had had many conversations on the beach about her and that was why he came back, implying that Gibbs still had feelings for her.

questions.text: Gibbs knew Jenny so well he could tell when she was lying. How?

answers.text: She'd look up and to the left.
answers.value: She'd look up and to the left.

response.info: When Gibbs showed up at Jenny's house right after she discovered the bottle of scotch and glass sitting on her desk, she tried to get Gibbs to leave. When she said a lie to him, he told her that her right eye twitched when she lied and it always had.

questions.text: To what city did the show mainly flashback when showing the viewers that Jenny and Jethro had a prior relationship?

response.info: The flashback shots were generally of Jenny and Jethro on a bed in a room that overlooked the Eiffel Tower. Paris was also the city where they each had a target - Jethro made his, but Jenny didn't. Because Jenny didn't kill her target, she was killed in "Judgment Day".

questions.text: What drink did Jethro get Jenny to start drinking?

response.info: According to Jenny, Gibbs didn't drink scotch.

questions.text: In "Honor Code", Jenny mentioned to Gibbs that he was great with kids and asked if he ever thought of having his own. What was Gibbs' response?
Gibbs and Jenny shared many things in the three seasons she was on the show. What of the following was NOT something they shared?

response.info: On a couple of occasions, including the episode where she had given up coffee, Jenny took Gibbs's coffee.

questions.text: What did Gibbs lie about in order to save Jenny's career?

answers.text: Her whereabouts when La Grenouille was killed
answers.value: Her whereabouts when La Grenouille was killed

response.info: At the end of the episode, when it was determined that La Grenouille was killed with Jenny's gun, Jenny said that she gave La Grenouille the gun and didn't know what happened after that. Gibbs knew this was a lie as he was with Jenny and saw La Grenouille put the gun back on her desk and leave.

info.description: La Grenouille was the foil for my favorite "NCIS" character, Jenny Shepard. See what you know about him.
info.name: "NCIS": La Grenouille Trivia Quiz
info.author: ladymacb29

questions.text: La Grenouille was a French arms dealer whom Gibbs liked to call what?

response.info: La Grenouille literally translates to 'frog' in French. Gibbs liked to tease Jenny by calling him the Frog, knowing that she didn't like it, and saying 'ribbit'.

questions.text: La Grenouille had a daughter named ____.

response.info: Jeanne Benoit is doing her residency at a DC hospital. While Gibbs was gone on his "margarita safari" (Jenny's words), she asked Tony to go on a deep undercover operation to get close to Jeanne and thereby target La Grenouille.

questions.text: Why did Jenny Shepard hate La Grenouille?

answers.text: He had convinced Gibbs not to marry her
answers.value: He had convinced Gibbs not to marry her

answers.text: She had orders to kill him from above
answers.value: She had orders to kill him from above

answers.text: She believed he murdered her father
answers.value: She believed he murdered her father

response.correct: She believed he murdered her father

questions.text: La Grenouille won a bid for _____, the Navy's system for missile guidance.

response.info: At the last minute, however, Jenny calls off the hit and lets La Grenouille leave. She had gotten a phone call that La Grenouille was a CIA source.

questions.text: Tony ended up in a limo with La Grenouille and La Grenouille's daughter. How did he try to get out and into his own car?

answers.text: Claimed he'd get a ticket if he didn't move his car
answers.value: Claimed he'd get a ticket if he didn't move his car

answers.text: Claimed he needed to go to the bathroom
answers.value: Claimed he needed to go to the bathroom

answers.text: Said he needed to go back to the hospital to sign a form
answers.value: Said he needed to go back to the hospital to sign a form

answers.text: Said he forgot he had to run an errand - in Canada
answers.value: Said he forgot he had to run an errand - in Canada

response.correct: Claimed he'd get a ticket if he didn't move his car
response.info: Jeanne, who had to return to the hospital anyway to sign a death certificate, claimed that they would ticket Tony for sure. While Jeanne is in the hospital signing the paperwork, Tony goes to his car to move it (and get away), but La Grenouille intervenes and gets Tony back into the limo.

questions.text: When Tony's car blows up (with la Grenouille's driver in it), what does La Grenouille think?

answers.text: The bomb was meant for him
answers.value: The bomb was meant for him

answers.text: His daughter tried to kill him
answers.value: His daughter tried to kill him

response.correct: The bomb was meant for him
response.info: My theory is Trent placed the bomb. NCIS determined the bomb was of the same configuration used in several other locations throughout the world - all killing arms dealers. It could have been Trent's way of sending a message to La Grenouille.

questions.text: La Grenouille was an oddity amongst arms dealers. Why?

answers.text: He wouldn't sell to groups whose names were on the Australian terrorist list
answers.value: He wouldn't sell to groups whose names were on the Australian terrorist list

answers.text: He refused to carry a weapon
answers.value: He refused to carry a weapon

response.correct: He refused to carry a weapon
response.info: All of the arms dealers had code names - La Grenouille, Goliath (the guy who alerted NCIS to the Ares deal), Black Rose (who used the name of a 16th century Irish pirate)... But only La Grenouille refused to carry a weapon.

questions.text: What did La Grenouille say to Jenny when she gave him her gun?

answers.text: You don't know what you're dealing with.
answers.value: You don't know what you're dealing with.

answers.text: You really do trust me, don't you?
answers.value: You really do trust me, don't you?

answers.text: I like my guns a little bigger.
answers.value: I like my guns a little bigger.

questions.text: Jeanne accused who of murdering La Grenouille?

response.info: One thing to note in this episode: Gibbs realizes La Grenouille had the same mark on his hand in the autopsy reports that Jasper Shepard's had, implying the same person murdered the two. It looks like the producers were trying to imply Trent murdered both Jasper Shepard and La Grenouille as Trent obviously lied to Fornell and Vance that La Grenouille's death was sanctioned by the CIA.

questions.text: Who, as we learn in "Judgment Day," really killed La Grenouille?

response.info: But contradicting Jenny's assertion to Vance and Fornell that La Grenouille took her gun, La Grenouille had in fact left it on her desk - which Gibbs knew. The next flashback is Jenny returning Gibb's clip - implying he had given it to her, she killed La Grenouille with her gun and his clip, threw her gun in the Potomac and returned Gibbs' clip to him.

info.description: Throughout the show, the NCIS crew keep referencing Gibbs' rules.  Here's a little quiz to test your knowledge on some of these rules.
info.name: "NCIS": Gibbs' Rules Trivia Quiz
info.author: evil44

questions.text: Rule #1: In the pilot episode "Yankee White", Gibbs is imparting his knowledge to Kate Todd.  Select the word that's missing from Rule #1.  "Never let ______ stay together."

response.info: It is unclear which Rule #1 belongs to Gibbs and which one he took from his mentor, Mike Franks.

questions.text: Rule #2: Right after telling Agent Todd Rule #1, Gibbs follows it up with Rule #2.  What good advice about crime scene contamination does Gibbs tell Kate?

answers.text: "Never wear athletic shoes in the field."
answers.value: "Never wear athletic shoes in the field."

answers.text: "Always wear gloves at a crime scene."
answers.value: "Always wear gloves at a crime scene."

response.correct: "Always wear gloves at a crime scene."
response.info: At first, Kate protests at having to wear the gloves, saying, "But my prints are all over this jet."  She later gives in and puts them on.  According to many forensic scientists, the two biggest problems for crime scene contamination are the responding emergency crews and the crime scene investigators.  For this reason (and other personal hygiene reasons), Gibbs ensures he and his crew always wear gloves when investigating a crime scene.

questions.text: Rule #6: This rule is mentioned in many episodes but people keep breaking it nonetheless.  Taken from a John Wayne quote, what is it that you should never say because it's a sign of weakness?
Rule #9: This rule has been referenced in quite a few episodes.  Can you remember the key word missing from the phrase?  "Never go anywhere without a _____."

response.info: The NCIS crew use their knives many times to help them with their investigations, or to get out of some pretty sticky situations.  Abby has her own Rule #9 and that is, "Always have a spare."

questions.text: Rule #13: What good piece of advice does Gibbs convey in Rule #13 that is as applicable for NCIS agents as it is for most other people?  "Never, ever involve ________."  What type of profession is Gibbs talking about?

response.info: In fact, at the end of "Rule Fifty-One", Gibbs pulls out Rule #13 from his storage box and circles it to emphasize the importance of that rule.

questions.text: Rule #18: This rule is not only used by Gibbs and his NCIS team often, it is also prevalent throughout many of the US military branches.  "It's better to seek forgiveness than _______________."

response.info: In the episode "Flesh & Blood", Tony tells Gibbs that he had to break Rule #6 due to the issues with his father (played by Robert Wagner) interfering with the case.  Gibbs responds that it's okay because he is covered by Rule #18.

questions.text: Rule #23: One of the time-honored Gibbs rules is to "never mess with a Marine's ______ if you want to live."  Fill in the blank.

response.info: Considering that Gibbs used to be Gunnery Sergeant in the US Marine Corps, this rule seems rather fitting.  Similar rules are common place in the other military branches, particularly referring to specific older non-commissioned officers that have become slightly addicted to the beverage over their long career.

questions.text: Rule #40: According to Abby, the 40s (Rules 40-49) are only used in emergencies.  So using that logic, what should complete Rule #40?  "If it seems someone is out to get you, _________!"

Rule #44: During the last two episodes of season seven ("Patriot Down" and "Rule Fifty-One"), Gibbs uses Rule #44 when sending a message to Mike Franks in Mexico.  What goes in the blank for Rule #44?  "First things first, hide the ________!"

response.info: Gibbs is warning Frank that Colonel Bell is on his way to probably do harm to Franks, Amira (his granddaughter) and Leyla (Amira's mother).  As it turns out, Franks has his right index finger shot off, but would later explain to Tony that he can still shoot with his thumb.

questions.text: Rule #51: At the end of the season seven episode "Rule Fifty-One", having just returned from Mexico, Gibbs writes down Rule #51 as he reminisces about his first wife and daughter.  What is Rule #51?

answers.text: Love is the most important thing.
answers.value: Love is the most important thing.

answers.text: Innocent suspects don't call for a lawyer.
answers.value: Innocent suspects don't call for a lawyer.

response.info: At the end of the episode, Reynosa is seen going into the general store in Stillwater, PA run by Gibbs' father, leaving a significant cliffhanger until the next season.

info.description: The members of NCIS, or the Naval Criminal Investigative Service, are tasked with the duty of protecting Marines and their families. This quiz is on the enigmatic team leader, Gibbs.
info.name: "NCIS" Characters: Gibbs Trivia Quiz
info.author: TheDoctorDonna

questions.text: What is Gibbs' full name and title?

response.info: Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs introduces himself as Jethro or Special Agent Gibbs. When Abby was creating a false ID for Gibbs, she asked him what name he wanted, his reply was 'Anything but Gus'.

questions.text: What is the name of the actor who plays Gibbs?

response.info: Gibbs is played by Mark Harmon, Sean Murray plays Tim McGee, Pauley Perrette plays Abby Scuito and Ducky is played by David McCallum.

questions.text: What was Gibbs' daughter's name?
What does Gibbs build in his basement?

response.info: He has built a couple of boats. One of the previous boats he named after an ex-wife, 'Diane'. He burnt it. When asked how he intended to get the boats out he replied that he can 'break a bottle of champagne over it in here'.

questions.text: Before he joined NCIS, Gibbs was a Marine. What was his rank?

response.info: Gibbs was a Gunnery Sergeant and a sniper. He used his skills as a sniper to kill the man that was responsible for the death of his first wife and daughter.

questions.text: How did Gibbs' first wife die?

response.info: Gibbs' wife witnessed the murder of a man and identified the killer. Although she and their daughter were under protection, a sniper shot their driver and they died in the resulting car crash.

questions.text: In the episodes "Hiatus I & II" Gibbs was knocked out in an explosion and temporarily lost his memory. How many years did he forget?

response.info: Gibbs regressed 15 years, believing that he had just been wounded in Desert Storm. It was Ziva, taking his hand and smacking herself on the back of her head with it, who brought his memory back completely.

questions.text: For half of the first season, Gibbs was obsessed with catching a terrorist who broke into the NCIS Autopsy and held Ducky, Kate and Gerald hostage. It took Gibbs half a season to discover this mans name. What was it?
Why does Gibbs smack members of his team across the back of the head?

response.info: Gibbs is famous for his head smacking if any member of his team messes up or does something silly they get a smack. He chooses the back of the head, rather than a slap in the face because it's a wake up call and a slap in the face is humiliating...

questions.text: Gibbs had a relationship with a member of NCIS. Who was it?

response.info: Jenny is the Director of NCIS. Abby is the only person in his team that Gibbs doesn't whack over the head. He has a bond with Ziva as she killed Ari, her half brother, to save Gibbs. Gibbs was responsible for hiring Kate.

info.description: This "NCIS" quiz will cover some of the personal rules of Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs. Have fun and good luck!
info.name: "NCIS:" Gibbs' Rules Trivia Quiz
info.author: jddrsi_raven

questions.text: Rule numbers 1, 2, and 3 all have two rules each. One set of rules are Gibbs' own personal rules. The other set of 3 came from whom?

response.info: Mike Franks was Agent Gibbs' first partner at NCIS. Franks spent his time in Mexico after his retirement. Every once in a while, a case would come up which would require Mike Franks' help, and when it was over, Franks would go back to his beach house in Mexico.

questions.text: "Rule number 8 is gonna save you, McGee!" What exactly is Gibbs' rule number 8?

answers.text: Never go anywhere without a knife
answers.value: Never go anywhere without a knife

response.info: This rule was mentioned in the episode "Probie." McGee was accused of killing an undercover cop from Metro. McGee was convinced that he killed an innocent police officer, but Abby pulled out rule number 8, and eventually, McGee was cleared.

questions.text: Rule number 10 is a rule that Agent Gibbs has said that he has struggled with in the past. What rule is rule number 10?

answers.text: Never get personally involved in a case
answers.value: Never get personally involved in a case

response.correct: Never get personally involved in a case

questions.text: There are two forms of rule number one. One of these, according to Gibbs himself, is more important than all the others. What rule supersedes all the others?

answers.text: Always wear gloves at a crime scene
answers.value: Always wear gloves at a crime scene

response.info: Rule number one is based on Gibbs' history as a Marine. Marines are loyal to their partners and units, hence the Marine term "semper fidelis" (always faithful). After his Marine days, he keeps the Marine attitude in his work at NCIS, including the most important of all, always stick with your partner.

questions.text: When Tony DiNozzo first joined NCIS, the first rule that he learned from Gibbs is rule number 5. Gibbs told him that he didn't have many rules (at the time), but that rule number 5 is __________.

answers.text: Always be specific when you lie
answers.value: Always be specific when you lie

response.info: Gibbs proved his point to DiNozzo by pointing him in the direction of the Human Resources office. Tony goes in on Gibbs' advice, and the rest is history.

questions.text: There is an age that everyone goes through where keeping secrets is fun. Gibbs' rule number 4 is about secrets, and it's not about fun, but according to Gibbs, the best way to keep a secret is what?

response.info: Gibbs made sure that people he worked for were aware that the more a secret is told, the more likely it is to be revealed.

questions.text: Agent Gibbs is good at keeping the majority of his rules, but he is really good at keeping rule number 11. Fill in the last part of rule 11: when the job is done, ______________.

response.info: Gibbs is very good at this rule, as every time a case ends, all he does at the end is walk away.

questions.text: Rule number 69 involves women, something in which Gibbs has dealt with through three marriages. Speaking to FBI Agent Fornell in the episode "Devil's Triangle," Gibbs says, "Never trust a woman ________."
According to Gibbs' rule number 27, how many ways are there to follow someone?

response.info: In the episode "Jacknife," Gibbs told his team that rule number 27 was, "There are two ways to follow. The first way, they never notice you, the second way, they only notice you." The team knew this rule and quoted it with Jethro.

questions.text: There are some rules that have not actually been spoken. One in particular was written down on a piece of paper.  Gibbs wrote on this paper, rule number 51. What is rule number 51?

response.info: After dealing with a particularly difficult case, Gibbs was remembering Shannon, his first wife. Shannon was the one who gave him the idea for his life's rules. He wrote rule number 51 down at the end of the episode, "Rule 51." His rule said, "Sometimes you're wrong." This proved that even Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs was wrong once in a while.

info.description: Jethro has a thing for redheads. But can you remember who is whom?
info.name: The Many Redheads of Jethro Gibbs Quiz
info.author: ladymacb29

questions.text: Who is Gibbs's first ex-wife?

response.info: Gibbs married Diane after Shannon and Kelly died. Diane claimed he only married her in an effort to get over the death of Shannon. Once Diane and Jethro divorced, she went on to marry Fornell... and divorce him too.

questions.text: Who did Jethro marry after he and Jenny broke up?

response.info: In "Ex-File", we met Stephanie, who is involved in a love quadrangle. In one scene (where Stephanie is complaining to Jenny about Jethro being involved in the case), Stephanie asks Jenny if there had ever been anything between her and Jethro, as she had the feeling they had been more than partners.

questions.text: Who gave Jethro an engraved flask?
Who lived with Jethro in Moscow?

response.info: In "Ex-File," we learn that Jethro lived with Stephanie in Moscow for a year. Jenny believed it was hard to live - with anyone - in Moscow, implying it was hard to live with Jethro anywhere.

questions.text: Who broke up with Jethro when he was being transferred from Europe to Washington, DC?

response.info: It's implied he had proposed to her when he learned he was being transferred back to Washington, DC, after they had been partners in Europe.

questions.text: Who kept Jethro's dog tags?

response.info: When Stephanie leaves Jethro at the end of the episode "Ex-File," she returns his dog tags. She had found them in a drawer years earlier.

questions.text: Whom did he name a boat after?

response.info: In "Kill Ari," Jenny is in Gibbs's basement and sees he is working on a boat - still. Gibbs responds that it isn't the same boat he was working on six years ago - he finished that one. When Jenny asks what happened to that oat, Gibbs reveals he set it on fire. That's when Jenny realizes he named it after Diane. Gibbs didn't want another man sailing off on her. Jenny then replied that she recalled Gibbs not caring who sailed off on her (meaning Fornell marrying Diane).

questions.text: In the episode "Check," who do we learn cheated on Gibbs?
When Jethro was on his "margarita safari" living with Mike Franks in Mexico, he admitted something to Franks. What was this secret?

answers.text: He and Diane never actually consummated their marriage
answers.value: He and Diane never actually consummated their marriage

answers.text: He still had feelings for Jenny
answers.value: He still had feelings for Jenny

response.correct: He still had feelings for Jenny
response.info: When Jenny and Mike Franks are sitting in the diner waiting for the bad guys to show up, they talk about roads not taken. Jenny tells him that she was the one who broke up with Jethro, although she still had feelings for him. Franks responds that Gibbs came back to NCIS, although Jenny thought he only came back for the Job. Franks then reveals that he and Jethro had had multiple conversations (implying about his feelings for her) about the subject.

questions.text: Which is not an ex-wife?

response.info: In "Hiatus", when Jethro is coming out of his coma, he asks if Jenny is an ex-wife. "God, no" was her reply.

questions.text: When Tony is in charge (during Gibbs' retirement), what does he call the group meetings?

questions.text: In season 3, Tony is offered his own team. Where would he and his team be?

response.info: Tony turned down the offer from Jenny Shepard because he claims that Gibbs was still suffering from memory loss and that he should stay. He was supposed to be transferred to Spain.

Which prank has Tony pulled on his co-workers?

answers.text: Putting a WHOOPIE-cushion on Gibbs' seat

answers.text: Tony is not the type of person to pull pranks

answers.text: Scaring Ziva with confetti that sounded like gun shots

questions.text: Gibbs' former NCIS mentor is whom?

response.info: After joining NIS in June 1992, Gibbs served under Special Agent Michael "Mike" Franks until the latter's retirement in 1996.  Franks still calls Gibbs "Probie."

questions.text: What are Gibb's wife and daughter's names?

response.info: Ducky once stated that they can close the book on the drug runner's disappearance after the death of Gibb's wife and daughter.  It was later learned that Gibbs had gained access to the drug runner's case file, crossed the border into Mexico and killed the man with a sniper rifle.

response.info: Gibbs told McGee this soon after he transferred to NCIS - McGee had the annoying habit of saying, "Sorry, Boss!"

response.info: Gibbs and Fornell have known each other for years and shared an ex-wife.

questions.text: Gibbs is addicted to what?

response.info: Caf-Pow! is Abby's favorite drink.  Gibbs (and Jenny) drink strong, black coffee that no one else can stand.

questions.text: Which NCIS team member is Gibbs' favorite?

response.info: Abby is often the only one who can get away with teasing Gibbs. He is particularly protective of her and he has a lot of faith in her knowledge of forensics, often relying on her for answers and help in solving cases.  Gibbs once declared that in the lab, "Abby doesn't have accidents."

questions.text: In season 4, it was discovered that Gibbs speaks what language?
Which of the following do we NOT know has happened to Gibbs by the time Jenny is killed?

response.info: Gibbs suffered a head wound after being injured in an explosion during Desert Storm.  He was in a coma for 19 days and was awarded the Purple Heart.  In 2006, Gibbs was in another explosion caused by a terrorist's bomb, after which he suffered selective amnesia.

questions.text: Timothy McGee is a very intelligent young man. His college GPA was 3.9. He mentions this in season 2 'Red Cell' as he was trying to catch a hacker. What class did he fail?

questions.text: In season two, Gibbs decides to test Tim's skills in the episode 'Witness'. What was the witness's name?

questions.text: In season five we almost lost our special agent Timothy McGee. In the episode 'Dog Tags' he is attacked by a dog and has to shoot the dog to survive. Abby falls in love and names the dog. What did she name him?

questions.text: What amazing actor plays Timothy McGee?

response.info: The book is called 'Deep Six: The continuing adventures of LJ Tibbs.' The character is, of course, based off his boss LJ Gibbs. Tommy and Lisa are based off of Tony and Ziva. Abby's character is named Amy Sutton and Jimmy Palmer reveals his character is Pimmy Jalmer.

questions.text: In what year was Timothy McGee born?
