answers.text: Right after Gibbs went to Autopsy
answers.value: Right after Gibbs went to Autopsy

answers.text: When Vance learned Mike Franks had been involved
answers.value: When Vance learned Mike Franks had been involved

response.correct: When Gibbs saw the picture of the blonde female
response.info: McGee pulled up the photos from Viggo's trip to the airport and the team noticed a blonde woman shared a cab with Viggo. Vance remarked that professionals didn't share cabs and started querying the team to find out if any of them knew who the woman was. When Vance turned around to ask Gibbs, Gibbs had already left.

questions.text: What did Abby say she'd always wanted to tell Jenny?

answers.text: Jenny's smile lit up the room
answers.value: Jenny's smile lit up the room

answers.text: Abby always wanted a mom like her
answers.value: Abby always wanted a mom like her

response.info: Abby liked the way Jenny had dressed, claiming it was very classic. She then broke down and told Gibbs that Jenny would have smiled at that thought and that she also liked the way Gibbs dressed.

questions.text: Who was drowning his/her sorrows in Autopsy?

response.info: Ziva entered autopsy and saw Tony drinking by himself. Tony was upset that Jenny had died alone - no husband, no children... He and Ziva then surmised that it must have been in Paris where Jenny and Gibbs got together.

questions.text: What did Gibbs find written on a piece of paper on Jenny's desk?
What was the insurance policy?

response.info: McGee determined the numbers were an old case number. When Vance went to the annex to look at the case file, he found only a telephone book in the case file. It turns out Mike Franks had figured it out, gotten the file, and left the phone book in its place. Vance figured out that Franks was the fifth shooter - Tony added that Franks was on Jenny's side.

questions.text: Who was the blonde with Viggo?

response.info: Natasha's real name was Svetlana. Gibbs had taken Viggo's cell phone. When Svetlana called, he answered and she realized where Gibbs was. Svetlana came to Jenny's house where Gibbs was and confronted him, intending to kill him for the man he had killed in Paris. Franks showed up at the right time and killed Svetlana. McGee traced Viggo's cell phone's location to Jenny's address and he went to confront Gibbs.

questions.text: What was the cover story for Jenny's death?

response.info: Gibbs and Franks burned down Jenny's townhouse, with Svetlana's body inside, to leave no loose ends. The cause of death was determined to be smoke inhalation by the medical examiner. (The cause of the fire was determined to be a gas pilot light.) The news reported that the body found inside was that of Jenny Shepard, Director of NCIS.

info.description: For fans and newcomers to "NCIS", the two-part third season premiere entitled "Kill Ari" brought significant cast and storyline changes. Let's remember these episodes and explore the people who make "NCIS" fun to watch.
info.name: Killing Ari: NCIS In Transition    Quiz
info.author: adam36

questions.text: Season two of "NCIS" ended with the shocking death of what principal cast member?

response.info: However, both "NCIS" and actress Sasha Alexander have thrived since she left the show. "NCIS's" ratings improved dramatically in subsequent years and the show was the number one rated show for the 2012-2013 ratings period. Alexander became the star of the hit cable show "Rizzoli & Isles". On a personal note, Alexander is also the daughter-in-law of Italian movie legend Sophia Loren as she married Loren's son Edoardo Ponti in 2007.

questions.text: At the beginning of "NCIS" season three, we are introduced to the mysterious foreign agent Ziva David. What intelligence agency does Ziva work for when the episode begins?

response.info: The Ziva character replaces Kate Todd as the female lead and slow smoldering love interest for DiNozzo. Despite not being either Jewish or Israeli, De Pablo's Ziva fit well into the "NCIS" team and is one of the major reasons that the show's ratings increased. De Pablo departed the show early in season 12, but her character was not killed off leaving open the possibility of a return and resolution of her relationship with DiNozzo.

questions.text: David McCallum portrays the beloved NCIS coroner Donald "Duck" Mallard. During the "Kill Ari" arc Ducky agrees to meet suspected terrorist Ari Haswari in exchange for the release of Ducky's lab assistant. What is the name of the unfortunate lab assistant?

NCIS gets a new Director as part of the cast changes that are introduced in episode 47 (season three episode one). What red-headed actress, who was married to Jim Carrey for a short time, plays the role of Jenny Shepherd?

response.info: Shepherd chose to further her career and ended her relationship with Gibbs. Shepherd (as is actress Holly) is a red-head. She thus fits the show's quirk that Gibbs is attracted to women with red-hair because his first wife Shannon (seen in flashback portrayed by Aviva Farber) was a red-head. Melinda McGraw and Kathleen York play two other red-headed ex-wives of the seemingly unlucky Gibbs.

questions.text: Complicated family relationships are a hallmark of "NCIS". Take the case of terrorist and assassin Ari Haswari the "Big Baddie" at the center of episodes 47-48. Who turns out to be Ari's father?

response.info: At the start of episode 47, the NCIS team believes that Ari killed Agent Kate Todd and that he is an Al-Qaeda terrorist leader. Mossad believes he is still acting on their behalf and Ziva David (implicitly at least in part because of the undisclosed family connection) is unwilling to accept that Ari as a bad guy.

questions.text: We learn in "NCIS" episode 47 that the quirky and brilliant NCIS forensic specialist Abby Sciuto and actress Pauley Perrette hail from the same US city famous for great food, music and night life. What is the city that also goes by the name "The Crescent City"?

response.info:
As a trained criminologist Perrette is a natural to portray the scientist of the NCIS team. 

In addition to her acting career Perrette has also a long affinity with music and has performed and written tunes that have appeared in "NCIS" and in movies such as "Legally Blond". Perrette is a human and animal rights activist with a deep commitment to supporting marriage equality rights. Based on the "Q" rating system of American pop culture awareness, Perrette frequently scores at the top for both likability and familiarity.

questions.text: "NCIS" episodes 47 and 48 were written by the creator and executive producer of NCIS. Who is this creative force behind "NCIS" (and its spin-offs) along with such other popular shows as "JAG", "Airwolf" and "Quantum Leap"?

response.info:
Donald Bellisario has made a very nice career creating and developing American television programs with an action-adventure format. Bellisario served in the US Marines during the 1950s before becoming an advertising writer and executive in the 1960s. In the 1970s, Bellisario moved to Los Angeles to pursue a desire to write and produce television shows. Bellisario worked with senior producer Glen Larson and together they created the highly rated Tom Selleck vehicle "Magnum P.I.". 

Bellisario developed the successful "JAG" program about Navy and Marine lawyers. "JAG" ran from 1995-2005. "NCIS" was a spin-off from "JAG", introduced during a two-part arc in season eight. Bellisario is also the step-father of "NCIS" co-star Sean Murray (Tim McGee) having married Murray's mother Vivienne in 1998. Chances are you have watched a movie or television show created by the men in the incorrect answers. Anthony Zuiker created "CSI", Dick Wolfe "Law & Order" and Jerry Bruckheimer is the producer of countless hit movies, including the "Beverly Hills Cop" and "Pirates of the Caribbean" franchises.

questions.text: During the "Kill Ari" arc we learn that Ari Haswari used a Bravo 51 sniper rifle to kill Agent Todd. This is the same type of gun that Agent Gibbs states he used in his time as a Marine sniper. By what prophetic nickname does Agent Gibbs state the Bravo 51 is called?

During a candid moment in "NCIS" episode 48, Ziva David states her sixteen sister was killed by a suicide bomb detonated by a terrorist organization. What Palestinian terror group does Ziva say killed her sister?

response.info: Hamas is an Arabic word meaning enthusiasm and an acronym that translates to Islamic Resistance Movement. Hamas the political group is an active terrorist organization in the Middle East. Hamas is also a political organization that has achieved a position of significant power within the Palestinian Parliament. Since its inception in the 1980s, Hamas has actively claimed responsibility for numerous deaths in Israel using, amongst other methods, suicide (explosives detonated while attached to the bomber)bombs as described by Ziva David in "NCIS" episode 48.

questions.text: "NCIS"'s two-part "Kill Ari" event ends with the death of terrorist Ari Haswari.  What character has to make the instant decision to kill Ari to save the life of NCIS Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs?

response.info: It is only then that we learn why David and Mossad had been unwilling to recognize Haswari's duplicity, as it is revealed that he is the son of the Mossad Deputy Director and the half-brother of Ziva David.

info.description: I love the holiday episodes, and this one is one of my favorites!. Do you remember the details from this season 6 Christmas episode?
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Silent Night" Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: During this episode's introduction, what Christmas song was playing in the background?

response.info: No, the episode's title is not the same as the song title. That would have been way too easy! This song was playing as the delivery guy took the wreath out of the back of his van.

questions.text: When Director Vance and Ziva are shown walking into the squad room, something about the Christmas tree bothered Vance. What about the tree did he fix as he walked past it?

response.info: The blinking lights on the Christmas tree apparently bothered Vance. As he walking by, he tinkered with the electrical plug and made the lights stop blinking.

questions.text: When Quinn supposedly died in the fire, what medical condition did Ducky say made his dental records useless for identification purposes?
When Dr. Pryor stopped by to talk to Ducky, he was on his way to the Children's Hospital. Who was he dressed as?

response.info: He was dressed as Santa Claus. Abby was reacting to him as if Santa were real, and that he was the real Santa. She even forced him into taking a picture with her!

questions.text: Abby is determined to get everyone a Christmas present. She makes the mistake of asking Gibbs what Tony needs. What does Gibbs suggest to Abby that Tony needs for Christmas?

response.info: Gibbs suggests that Tony needs an attitude adjustment. Tony is typically distracted by women, video games, various websites, etc. You have to give him credit, though. He always comes through in a pinch.

questions.text: Where does Jethro first make contact with Quinn?

response.info: Ducky gave Jethro the idea that Quinn could be found honoring the memory of his friend's death at the Vietnam Veteran's Memorial on the day of the anniversary of his death. Ducky was correct. Gibbs met him there and confronted him.

questions.text: After his initial interview with Quinn, Jethro's famous gut told him that he was innocent. Quinn mentioned during this something that Ducky found to be true. This truth supported his innocence. What action by Quinn was found to be true and supported his innocence?

answers.text: he bandaged the male victim's wounds
answers.value: he bandaged the male victim's wounds

answers.text: he fought off the murderer as best he could
answers.value: he fought off the murderer as best he could

answers.text: he called an ambulance for the victims
answers.value: he called an ambulance for the victims

answers.text: he did CPR on the female victim
answers.value: he did CPR on the female victim

response.correct: he did CPR on the female victim
response.info: Quinn claimed to have been in the garage while the attack happened and that he walked in and found the victims in the living room. He said that he tried to revive the wife by using CPR. Ducky spoke with the Metro medical examiner and found out the he noticed bruising that is consistent with CPR.

questions.text: When Gibbs and the team went to the scene of the crime, one of the team members found the murder weapon in the garage. Who found it there?

When Gibbs and the team confront the security guard about his involvement in the murders, he pulls out a taser. The team reminds him that the taser is a one shot, non-fatal weapon and that there are 5 agents there. As a last show of force, who does the security officer shock with the taser?

response.info: I didn't even list Gibbs as an option because no one would dare tase Gibbs! McGee was the one who was standing the closest to the security guard, so he was the most likely to get tased.

questions.text: At the end of the episode, Gibbs drops Quinn off at his daughter's house. He doesn't want to get out of the car because he doesn't want to cause his daughter any more pain. Gibbs talks him into going by telling him what his own Christmas wish would be. What was Gibbs' Christmas wish?

response.info: It's nice to occasionally see a softer side of Gibbs.

info.description: "Judgment Day" is one of those episodes that turn a series upside-down. As usual, my questions end up being out of order.
info.name: "NCIS" - "Judgment Day," Part I Quiz
info.author: ladymacb29

questions.text: What was the name of the man whose funeral Jenny Shepard was attending?

response.info: William Decker had worked with Jenny and Gibbs in Europe. Decker was in charge of getting Gibbs and Jenny fake IDs and such. When Jenny heard he'd died of a heart attack, she at first felt relieved but at the funeral realized Decker had actually been murdered.

questions.text: At the funeral, Jenny heard this word mentioned by an unknown man.

response.info: "Oshimaida" was a codeword that Decker, Jenny, and Gibbs were to use if they were compromised. When Jenny overheard a man asking if anyone named Oshimaida had signed the condolence book at Decker's funeral, she realized that Decker had been murdered and now someone was looking for her and Gibbs.

questions.text: What was Ducky working on while things were slow?

answers.text: Reading up on the wingspan of a fruit fly
answers.value: Reading up on the wingspan of a fruit fly

questions.text: Who did Jenny call to help her track down Decker's murderer?

response.info: She called Mike Franks to help because she needed someone outside the agency. Franks thought that meant he was on her short list, but it was actually Gibbs who was on Jenny's short list and because Gibbs trusted Franks with his life, that made him the person she called.

questions.text: What was the name of the girlfriend who died?

response.info: Jenny told Sasha to get out of town and gave Sasha the keys to her rental. Sasha's body was found in close proximity to Jenny's rental car, which alerted Tony and Ziva to the fact that Jenny was probably in trouble.

questions.text: Why did Tony believe that Jenny had given him and Ziva the day off?

answers.text: Jenny was a woman with urges
answers.value: Jenny was a woman with urges

answers.text: Jenny wanted to sneak out of the country
answers.value: Jenny wanted to sneak out of the country

answers.text: She knew the pair worked hard and wanted to reward them
answers.value: She knew the pair worked hard and wanted to reward them

answers.text: Jenny was tired of hearing Tony's movie quotes
answers.value: Jenny was tired of hearing Tony's movie quotes

response.correct: Jenny was a woman with urges
response.info: Ziva was suspicious from the beginning and wanted to remain at the hotel in case Jenny needed them. Tony, on the other hand, believed that she was a woman with urges and was out with a man. When Tony and Ziva called her and heard Mike's voice in the background, Tony took that as confirmation of his hunch.

questions.text: Whom did Jenny call to ask for an ID of the man she saw at the funeral?

response.info: She sent the photos to Abby and told her not to tell anyone about them. However, Abby needed McGee's help to identify the man as Viggo Drantyev - which was a fake name.

questions.text: What clue did Jenny find at the diner?
How did Jenny reply when Franks mentioned that Gibbs had let her go?

response.info: Gibbs had wanted to stay together with Jenny, but Gibbs didn't fit into her five point plan, so she was the one who broke it off. Franks said that Jenny was still young and she had time to right things.

questions.text: How did Franks really know Jenny was ill?

answers.text: He overheard a call from Ducky
answers.value: He overheard a call from Ducky

response.info: Franks originally said he saw it in her eyes, but Jenny didn't buy it. He then explained he had searched her phone, glove compartment and purse. It was in the purse that he found her pills. She told Franks that Gibbs didn't know and he asked why she didn't tell him. She replied that she didn't know.

questions.text: What happened to Jenny in Paris?

answers.text: She was kidnapped by the KGB
answers.value: She was kidnapped by the KGB

answers.text: She was responsible for killing an NCIS agent
answers.value: She was responsible for killing an NCIS agent

answers.text: She didn't make the kill she was supposed to
answers.value: She didn't make the kill she was supposed to

response.correct: She didn't make the kill she was supposed to
response.info: Franks commented that he was surprised Jenny hadn't made the hit. Gibbs responded that Jenny was softer back then and he'd taught her.

questions.text: Who taught Jenny how to pick a lock?
How did Franks say Vance could get the insurance policy?

answers.text: If Vance could solve a few riddles
answers.value: If Vance could solve a few riddles

answers.text: If Vance could pay enough money for it
answers.value: If Vance could pay enough money for it

response.info: Franks said he'd leave Vance the insurance policy in his will. We never really found out what was in it in this episode.

questions.text: What did Vance NOT do in the office when taking over as Director of NCIS?

response.info: At the end of the episode, Vance was named Director of NCIS and he quickly un-did everything Jenny had done - removed her father's photograph from the desk, sent Ziva back to Israel, and broke up the rest of Gibbs' team.

questions.text: What was Franks' excuse for Svetlana's murder?

answers.text: Had to kill the head of the snake
answers.value: Had to kill the head of the snake

response.info: Vance responded that it had been sanctioned - 9 years ago.

info.description: This quiz is about the fifth season episode of "N.C.I.S" entitled "Dog Tags."
info.name: "N.C.I.S". - "Dog Tags" Trivia Quiz
info.author: robbyroo72

questions.text: Gibbs, Ziva, DiNozzo and McGee arrive at the house of a dog handler to serve search and arrest warrants on him.  When they get inside the house, they find him dead in his living room.  While Ziva, Gibbs and DiNozzo are in the living room with the dead handler, where is McGee when he's attacked by the dog?

answers.text: McGee isn't attacked by a dog
answers.value: McGee isn't attacked by a dog

response.info: The sound of gunshots bring Gibbs, DiNozzo and Ziva running out the back door with their guns drawn only to find the injured dog and then an injured McGee.

questions.text: Which country crooner sings the song that's playing just as Gibbs, DiNozzo and Ziva find McGee on the ground after the dog attack?

response.info: The name of the song is entitled "Bad Dog, No Biscuit" and is off the second album released by Daron Norwood.  While Toby Keith and Billy Ray Cyrus do not sing songs on other episodes, Josh Turner's "Your Man" is played in the season three episode entitled "Ravenous."

questions.text: After McGee leaves with the dog, Gibbs, DiNozzo and Ziva are investigating the death of Petty Officer Hanson.  DiNozzo gives the dog, who not only attacked McGee but is believed to have killed its handler too, a funny nickname.  What nickname did DiNozzo give the dog?
What drug did Ziva find in Petty Officer Hanson's bedroom?

response.info: While Tony was busy making his dog jokes and Gibbs was telling him to play dead, Ziva strayed in to Petty Officer Hanson's bedroom and found a package of what looked to be cocaine hidden under his bed.  After testing it and proving that it was cocaine, Gibbs suspects that Petty Officer Hanson was the leader in a drug-smuggling ring bringing the drug in to the United States.

questions.text: When Abby leaves headquarters with Jethro, the dog, she takes him to the Navy Base and is encountered by a Military Police Officer who questions her visit to the base.  What does Abby say she's looking for during this visit?

response.info: The scene shows Abby driving up in her classic roadster with Jethro in the passengers seat.  When she stops at the main gate, the M.P. Officer asks her if he can help her and she says, "I'm looking for fleas."  The officer looks at Abby for a second and when she shows her "N.C.I.S" credentials, allows her on to the base.

questions.text: When Abby stops her car, she opens the door and Jethro bolts for a hill across the street.  When she catches up to him, he's digging at something but doesn't see what it is because she answers her ringing cell phone.  As she's talking to McGee, what does she see that Jethro dug up?

response.info: Abby, who was not supposed to take Jethro out of her lab, has helped uncover a key piece of evidence in the murder of Petty Officer Hanson.  Jethro has unearthed skeletal remains of another dog.

questions.text: Which person is sent to pick up Jethro from Abby so he can be put down?

response.info: We already know that Petty Officer Hanson is dead because of the opening scenes of this episode.  We also know that neither Director Shepard or the Secretary of the Navy are dog handlers, thus leaving Petty Officer Erica Pereli as the person who made two trips to pick up Jethro.

questions.text: As the show nears its conclusion, Abby rushes Jethro down to autopsy and tells Ducky that he started coughing up blood.  Ducky and Jimmy perform surgery and find something very interesting inside Jethro's stomach.  What was the item they found in his stomach?
Who is identified as the person that killed the drug-tracking dog and Petty Officer Hanson?

response.info: After finding the military issue knife tip, Gibbs orders McGee to find out who requisitioned a new boot knife within the past 72 hours and they find that it was Petty Officer Erica Pereli.  She claims to have lost hers a few days before but the truth of the matter is that she killed Petty Officer Hanson's drug sniffing dog and replaced that dog with Butch, an attack dog, and then killed Petty Officer Hanson while planting drugs and money in his house.  Like Jethro the dog, her dog is not trained to seek out drugs, her dog is an attack dog.

questions.text: At the end of this episode, we see that Abby is depressed because her landlord will not let her keep Jethro in her apartment.  Who does she convince to take Jethro in as a pet?

response.info: Abby convinces McGee to look at the big picture.  He had been looking for a dog as a pet, Jethro was in need of a loving home, so it was natural to her that she match the two up.  Before finally agreeing, McGee has the second funniest line in the episode.  He says, "Abby, that dog has tasted my blood and I think he likes it."

info.description: Here is a short quiz on my favorite "NCIS" episode. Good luck!
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Call of Silence" Quiz
info.author: rayven80

questions.text: Where does Gibbs meet Ernie Yost?

response.info: Gibbs meets Ernie Yost as he is coming through security. Yost sets the metal detector off because he is carrying a pistol he has brought for evidence against himself for the murder of his buddy, Cpl Wade Keene. When searched for further metals, the security guard comes across his Medal of Honor.

questions.text: What does Abby find in the gun that may disprove Yost's claim to murder?

answers.text: Nothing, she proves he shot Keene
answers.value: Nothing, she proves he shot Keene

response.info: When confronted with the test results, Yost tells Gibbs that he never said he shot Keene. Yost tells Gibbs that he hit Keene over the head with it. But when asked why he killed his buddy, Yost could not remember.

questions.text: Who is sent home with Yost to keep an eye on him?
Yost married Keene's widow after the war.

response.info: He takes this information back to Gibbs as a possible motive for Yost killing Keene. Later, Yost tells Gibbs that Keene knew Yost was going to marry Dorothy and that it was okay.

questions.text: Did the military use Social Security numbers as ID in World War 2?

response.info: The military didn't start to use Social Security Numbers as ID's until 1969.

questions.text: What was found in Cpl. Keene's teeth?

response.info: When a soldier dies and his remains can't be recovered immediately, one dog tag was stuck between the teeth and the jaw forcibly closed. This assured that the remains could be identified at a later date. There was a myth about that being the reason for the notch on older dog tags, but it was later shown that the notch was to hold the tag in place on the machine that imprinted the information onto it.

questions.text: What is the result of the investigation?

answers.text: Keene wasn't killed on Iwo Jima
answers.value: Keene wasn't killed on Iwo Jima

answers.text: Keene died as a direct result of combat
answers.value: Keene died as a direct result of combat

answers.text: Yost hit Keene to quiet him, not kill him
answers.value: Yost hit Keene to quiet him, not kill him

answers.text: Yost killed Keene to get Dorothy
answers.value: Yost killed Keene to get Dorothy

response.correct: Yost hit Keene to quiet him, not kill him
response.info: When Lt. Commander Coleman sees the display that Gibbs set up in interrogation, she decides that she will tell the Secretary of the Navy that Yost is suffering from delayed post traumatic stress and that Cpl. Keene was killed in action.

questions.text: Hitoshi Yoshida, former Lieutenant of the Japanese Imperial Army, comes into assist in the investigation. Does he have any information that will absolve Yost?
Why did Yost kill Keene?

response.info: The Japanese were advancing only a few yards from where Yost's unit was hiding. Keene had just had both legs blown off by a land mine and Yost hit him to keep him quiet. He did not mean to kill him. Yost was cited for gallantry the next day after killing 26 Japanese soldiers "In a self-sacrificing defense of his forward position.".

questions.text: Which battle did Yoshida and Yost both fight in?

response.info: After that the two elderly men touch saki cups in a toast.

info.description: Remember this episode? A blogger that's been trashing NCIS is found dead on a construction site and the team is accused of covering up the death of a promising Navy Academy graduate. Remember the details?
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "The Inside Man" Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: When the blogger, Matt Burns, fell to his death onto the construction site, how many pieces of rebar were shown sticking through his chest?

answers.text: 0, he landed on a dirt mound
answers.value: 0, he landed on a dirt mound

response.info: Just as the construction workers were sipping their coffee waiting for the rest of the team to get there, they see a body hit the ground a few feet away from them. As the body is shown, you can see two pieces of rebar sticking through his chest. Upon seeing this, one of the workers drops his coffee cup. So much for his extra foam, add a shot, hazelnut latte! (That would have made a tough question, huh?)

questions.text: When DiNozzo first meets Detective Hanley at the crime scene, he criticizes her for doing something that could contaminate the crime scene. What did he criticize her for?

response.info: He criticized her for wearing a very long scarf while she was looking for evidence inside the car. He reminded her that threads from the scarf could fall off in the car and contaminate the evidence. Tony was also quick to say that it's a common mistake that everyone has made at least once.

questions.text: What was the nickname of Matt Burns, the dead blogger?
Down in autopsy, Ducky is having a hard time getting his new toy to work properly. What new toy was Ducky trying fix?

response.info: Ducky was tinkering with his new portable x-ray machine. It seems that the directions telling him how to fix the problem were not actually fixing the problem. Ducky mentions some dislike for the person who wrote the manual for the machine.

questions.text: For the entire episode, McGee seems stressed out. What is he so stressed out about?

answers.text: a crazy girlfriend is running up his credit cards
answers.value: a crazy girlfriend is running up his credit cards

answers.text: the Director wants to send him back to the cyber unit
answers.value: the Director wants to send him back to the cyber unit

answers.text: for an unknown reason, Abby is mad at him
answers.value: for an unknown reason, Abby is mad at him

answers.text: he was asked to retake his polygraph examination
answers.value: he was asked to retake his polygraph examination

response.correct: he was asked to retake his polygraph examination
response.info: McGee is stressed out because he was asked to retake his polygraph exam. He is not sure why he is being asked to retake it, but he assumes that the reason cannot be a good one. Because of working the case, he misses his appointment to retake the exam. When he no-shows, the examiner comes looking for him.

questions.text: What was the name of the SEC (Securities and Exchange Commission) representative that assisted the NCIS team on this case?

response.info: The minute this guy said his name, he received a strange look from Tony. He was quick to add that this was his real name and not to bother with jokes because he's heard them all already. He even wore the wire rim glasses. It was a great touch by the producers of the show to add the patriotic flute sound bites to this scene.

questions.text: When Tony goes to Sutton's sandwich shop to interview him about his knowledge of Lt. Arnette, he returns to NCIS with a sandwich from the shop. What type of sandwich did he get?

response.info: The sandwich he got was pastrami. Tony ate the sandwich in front of McGee, who was working. When McGee asked Tony for a bite, he crammed the entire sandwich in his mouth. McGee was quick to tell Tony that he hoped he choked on it.

questions.text: In order to recheck the results of their initial investigation, Gibbs wants Lt. Arnette's body exhumed and a toxicology screen done on his brain matter. As Ducky and Abby open to coffin to run their tests, what do they find?

answers.text: the skeletal remains of at least 5 bodies
answers.value: the skeletal remains of at least 5 bodies

answers.text: a body that is not Lt. Arnette's
answers.value: a body that is not Lt. Arnette's

answers.text: there is no body, only metal weights
answers.value: there is no body, only metal weights

response.correct: there is no body, only metal weights

questions.text: In this episode, Tony and McGee get arrested. What did they do to get arrested?

answers.text: trespassing in Metro P.D.'s impound lot
answers.value: trespassing in Metro P.D.'s impound lot

response.correct: trespassing in Metro P.D.'s impound lot
response.info: The boys decided to sneak into Metro P.D.'s impound lot in order to get the GPS data off of Lt. Arnette's car. They hoped to use this information to help solve the case. Luckily, they were able to send the data to Abby before they were caught in the impound lot.

questions.text: During the end of the episode, we find out that someone has the hots for McGee. Who was interested in McGee?

response.info: At the end of the episode, we see McGee retaking his polygraph exam. The examiner asks him questions that obviously imply she is interested in him. McGee, however, seems oblivious to this fact until Gibbs mentions it to him.

info.description: For hardcore "NCIS" fans: information on season 1, episode 1.
info.name: "NCIS"- Season 1, Episode 1 Trivia Quiz
info.author: wmucker93

questions.text: What is the title of this episode?

response.info: Although many television shows' first episode is called a pilot, "NCIS"'s pilot is considered to be their appearances on "JAG".

questions.text: What is the name of the first victim?

response.info: Commander Ray Trapp started to convulse and then foam at the mouth following the lunch he had with President Bush.

questions.text: Where does the first victim die?
Where do Special Agents Gibbs and DiNozzo fly to meet the corpse?

response.info: AF-29000 was forced to stop in Wichita for the president to switch planes to take him out of harm's way.

questions.text: Why did Kate resign from the Secret Service?

response.info: When talking to Kate's former superior, Gibbs is told that she was right to resign because "she broke the rules".

questions.text: Who joins the team?

response.info: After Kate Todd resigns from the Secret Service, Gibbs offers her a job, which she later accepts.

questions.text: Who was suggested as being behind the murders?

response.info: During satellite communications, Agent Fornell says that is most likely an Al-Qaeda sleeper cell that poisoned the victims.

questions.text: DiNozzo is always getting himself into trouble. In what sticky situation does DiNozzo end up?
Who was the second victim?

response.info: Maj. Tim Kerry dies shortly after having drinks with Kate and the reporter dies later on "NCIS". Both of the victims died the same way as Commander Trapp.

questions.text: What did Gibbs say to Kate that surprised the whole team?

response.info: When Gibbs asks Kate to accompany her on Air Force One he is forced to be polite.

info.description: Jethro's great with kids, as we see in this episode. Do you remember the details?
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Lost and Found" Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: As this episode begins, we see Abby talking to a group of boy scouts. She is no doubt giving them a tour of the forensics lab. During this tour, Abby mentions that what device is the "king of forensic technology"?

response.info: Abby loves her mass spectrometer so much, it even has a nickname. She calls it Mr. Mass Spec. The kids seem kind of bored with her scientific explanations.

questions.text: The kids don't seem to be very interested in Abby's mass spectrometer. They, do, however, seem to be VERY interested in what?

response.info: Being that the group is a bunch of young boys, they all take a strong interest in Abby's tattoos. She tells them that she has a bunch and the boys complain about only being able to see a few of them. The kids try very hard to persuade Abby to show them the rest of her tattoos.

questions.text: What computer program found a match with Carson's fingerprint?
When Gibbs first walks in and meets Carson, what type of drink did he give him?

response.info: Gibbs gave Carson a Coke, a caffeine free diet coke to be exact. Don't you hate it when they have to disguise the real product name? As if we couldn't tell that a gold colored can with red and black lettering isn't a caffeine free diet coke!

questions.text: How did Carson's biological mom die?

answers.text: she's still alive, Carson lives with her.
answers.value: she's still alive, Carson lives with her.

response.info: Carson's biological mom drowned when Carson was very young. About a year later, his dad married Elaine.

questions.text: On what quiz topic did Carson beat Tony's record that he held for two years?

response.info: This question should be obvious. Tony is full of useless movie references. His knowledge of movies was unmatched until Carson showed up.

questions.text: Abby found Brian Taylor's fingerprints on his computer. She ran them and found that they matched the fingerprints found on what type of gun that was used in a shooting in May of 1998?

response.info: His prints matched those on a Beretta. A Sig Sauer is the type of gun most federal agents, including NCIS, use. Lots of police agencies carry Glocks, and the Walther PPK was James Bond's weapon of choice.

questions.text: What type of music did Carson have playing when Jethro came to see him at Director Shepard's house?
What game were Jenny and Carson playing while sitting on the floor of her office?

answers.text: none, they were tossing cards into a basket
answers.value: none, they were tossing cards into a basket

response.correct: none, they were tossing cards into a basket
response.info: They were trying to see who could toss the most cards into the basket. They seemed to be having fun until Jethro came in and asked to see Jenny's phone. After looking at it, he realized that Carson had warned his dad that Jethro and the team were after him.

questions.text: Who was playing Pictionary with Carson?

response.info: Carson was playing Pictionary with Jimmy. Jimmy was drawing a picture of a school. Carson guesses that he was drawing the Playboy Mansion. Jimmy then accused him of being related to DiNozzo.

info.description: Remember this episode? Ziva is almost killed by a serial killer while undercover. That's the overview. Now see if you can remember the details!
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Recoil" Trivia Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: During the episode's introduction, the killer was seen washing the victim's blood off of his hands. Which hand was the killer wearing his watch on?

answers.text: he had one on both hands
answers.value: he had one on both hands

response.info: The killer was wearing a watch on his left hand. Most people wear their watch on their non-dominant hand. Since about 91% of people in the world are right handed, most people wear their watch on their left hand. I'm an odd ball, I'm left handed and wear my watch on my left hand.

questions.text: After the killer washes his hands, he leaves the house and gets into a car with Ziva, who is under cover. What color was the car that Ziva was driving?

response.info: The car was fairly dark blue color. It was a different make and model from the government cars the team usually drives. For once, Ziva wasn't driving like a bat out of you know where!

questions.text: Tony was also undercover in the beginning of this episode. He was dressed as some type of technician wearing white coveralls. What was the name on the patch that was on the left chest pocket of these coveralls?
Ziva's cover is blown when the killer sees what name on the caller ID of her cell phone?

response.info: McGee called from Gibbs' phone to give her the code word telling her that the guy in the car with her was indeed the killer.

questions.text: Upon returning to the office after killing the murderer, Ziva reaches into her desk to grab something. What did she grab?

response.info: The shot made it look like she was reaching for her gun, but she grabbed some medicine, probably Advil or Tylenol. Judging by the gash above her eye, she probably had a headache.

questions.text: What is different about Abby throughout most of this episode?

response.info: Throughout most of this episode, Abby is wearing roller blades. She says it increased her efficiency by allowing her to get from place to place faster. Towards the end of the episode, Gibbs finally tells her to lose the wheels.

questions.text: What is the name of the guy at the bar that Ziva eventually hooks up with?

response.info: His name was Michael Locke. The team was convinced that Michael was an accomplice to the serial killer, but Ziva's gut told her he was innocent.

questions.text: O+ and A+ blood types were found by Abby on the murder weapon. These blood types matched the victims. Another blood type was also found on the knife. It was thought to be the killer's, but this was disproved because the serial killer had type _______ blood.
Who came into the autopsy lab while Ziva was staring at Hoffman's body?

response.info: Gibbs comes down to autopsy to check on Ziva. He tells her she had to let it go. Ziva felt that she could not trust her judgment because she almost let herself be killed by Hoffman. Gibbs reminds her that the minute she stops trusting her judgment, she becomes a detriment to the team.

questions.text: Ziva proved to the team that her guy friend was innocent by comparing his fingerprint to a partial that was found on the murder weapon. Where did she get one of his fingerprints?

answers.text: from the barrel of her gun
answers.value: from the barrel of her gun

answers.text: from the part of her badge that he touched
answers.value: from the part of her badge that he touched

answers.text: from a glass from his kitchen
answers.value: from a glass from his kitchen

answers.text: from a beer bottle from the bar
answers.value: from a beer bottle from the bar

response.correct: from the barrel of her gun
response.info: After Ziva went home with Michael from the bar, he reaches across Ziva to get his glasses. This spooked Ziva, and she pulled her gun on him. After he explains himself, he takes his finger and pushes the barrel of the gun away from his face.

info.description: DiNozzo's dream.... an investigation at a bikini contest! Too bad his focus is supposed to be on a dead Navy woman!
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Bikini Wax" Trivia Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: The dead Navy woman, Tiffany Jordan, was found dead with her head in a bathroom toilet. According to a local police lieutenant, who found her there?

answers.text: an off duty Virginia Beach police officer
answers.value: an off duty Virginia Beach police officer

answers.text: a drunk man that wondered into the wrong bathroom
answers.value: a drunk man that wondered into the wrong bathroom

response.info: According to the lieutenant, an elderly woman found Tiffany at about 1400 hours. She mentioned that she doesn't typically use public restrooms because she has a phobia of them. I doubt walking in and finding this will help that phobia!

questions.text: The victim was wearing a bikini that had a floral pattern made up of what two colors?

response.info: Her bathing suit had a teal and brown floral print. She was also wearing high heels. Just as a note, her bathing suit looked just like the one that Tony gave to Kate at the end of "The Immortals" episode.

questions.text: As Tony and Abby enter the squad room from the elevator, Abby compliments a piece of Tony's clothing. What did she compliment?

When the team is in the bathroom processing the crime scene, Tony mentions that the way the victim is positioned looks like a "swirly". Tired of the guys wasting time talking abut hazing, Gibbs tells them to get back to work or he'll show them hazing. He adds that the Marine Corps dos not do which 3 types of hazing?

response.info: Gibbs is obviously implying that the Marine Corps' hazing practices are much more severe than the ones that McGee endured in high school.

questions.text: During the autopsy, Ducky found out why the victim was vomiting. Why was Tiffany vomiting?

answers.text: she was at a party the previous night and drank too much
answers.value: she was at a party the previous night and drank too much

answers.text: she was nervous about the bikini contest
answers.value: she was nervous about the bikini contest

response.info: Ducky told Jethro that Tiffany was vomiting because she was suffering from a hormonal imbalance. He then specified that it was a drastic rise in her estrogen levels. Gibbs knew that a rise in estrogen meant she was pregnant and that her vomiting was probably from morning sickness.

questions.text: When McGee and Tony were talking about their spring break experiences, McGee mentioned that Tony went to what university?

response.info: McGee was surprised that Tony went to Panama City Beach for spring break because he went to Ohio State University. That seemed like a long way away for a spring break trip. McGee mentions that most people at MIT never went on spring break. For some reason, Tony did not seem surprised about McGee's comment.

questions.text: Tony and McGee went on board a US Navy ship to speak to Tiffany's former rack mate. What does Tony tell McGee is not a good trait for someone who investigates the Navy?

response.info: McGee is definitely afraid of heights; this phobia is mentioned in several episodes. In this episode, however, we see that McGee gets sea sick when he gets on the ship. In fact, Tiffany's former rack mate offered to get him some Dramamine. That was very nice of her, but McGee had already taken 6 of them!

questions.text: During part of the autopsy, Jimmy Palmer found a substance in the victim's hair. Abby later positively identified this substance as what?
What does Lisa Kerr teach at her home?

response.info: She teaches yoga at her home. As Gibbs and Tony go to her home to interrogate her, they see the rear ends of a bunch of women doing yoga in that yard by the ocean.

questions.text: What was the name of the magazine photo shoot that Tiffany Jordan posed for? (Hint: the Navy reprimanded her for doing it.)

response.info: The photo shoot she did was called "Naughty in the Navy". The Navy frowns upon its members posing nude. The shoot was not nude, so she simply got a slap on the back of the hand.

info.description: Remember this one? Tony and Jeanne are held prisoner in the hospital morgue by an angry drug dealer. Remember the details?
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Angel of Death" Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: During the introduction, what type of vehicle hit Devon?

response.info: As Devon is sending a text message to Bernie, he is struck by a taxi cab. Just before his happens, a little girl with Shirley Temple hair walks past. This girl is seen several more times during the episode, particularly when something bad is about to happen. Presumably, this little girl is the representation of the angel of death.

questions.text: As seen in this episode, McGee panics when taking what type of test?

response.info: This reads as a lie. As Gibbs and Tony remind him, he also answers to Probie and Elf Lord.

questions.text: When Gibbs talks to FBI Agent Tobias Fornell, he learns that the CIA is interested in which person?

At the beginning of this episode, Director Shepard is returning from a trip to Europe. We find out later that Jenny snuck away from her protection detail. How long was she "off the radar" away from her protection detail?

response.info: The CIA is interested in what Director Shepard did during those 21 hours that her where abouts could not be accounted for.

questions.text: When Tony was in the hospital elevator with Bernie and Nick, he calls Nick by a different name. By what name does he call him?

response.info: Tony calls him Bobby. Bernie, who is suffering from horrible drug withdrawal symptoms, seems perplexed as to why Tony called Nick by the wrong name.

questions.text: During this episode, what floor of the hospital is Jeanne working on?

response.info: She was working on the orthopaedic floor. When Devon was sent to the hospital, he had a badly broken leg. With this type of injury, he ended up on the ortho floor.

questions.text: Devon had ingested several bags of a drug in order to smuggle them into the United States. While in the hospital, one of the bags ruptured, causing him to die of an overdose. What drug was it that he had overdosed on?

response.info: Devon overdosed on heroin that he was bringing into the country from Venezuela. Jeanne suspected this, but was not able to treat Devon in time to save his life.

questions.text: Who or what does Gibbs have McGee hack into?
Nick and Bernie go down to the hospital morgue in order to cut the drugs out of Devon's stomach. Why is Jeanne so determined to get them to turn around?

answers.text: She doesn't want to get the hospital in trouble

answers.value: She doesn't want Bernie to witness her brother getting carved up

response.correct: She doesn't want Bernie to witness her brother getting carved up
response.info: Jeanne is concerned for Bernie's well being. She absolutely does not want Bernie to watch as Nick forces her to cut open Devon to retrieve the drugs.

questions.text: At the end of the episode, how does Bernie get some drugs to relieve her withdrawal symptoms?

answers.text: she snorts it off the floor after Jeanne opened a bag to distract Nick

answers.text: she opens one of the bags that was retrieved from Devon's stomach

response.correct: she snorts it directly off of Devon's exposed intestines
response.info: This was an awesome, yet unexpected scene. Jeanne intentionally disperses a bag of heroin into the air to distract Nick. It works. Nick is subdued. As Tony and Jeanne turn around to check on Bernie, they see her snorting heroin directly off of her brother's ravaged intestines.

info.description: The hit series all started with "Yankee White", the pilot episode originally broadcast on September 23, 2003.  This quiz will challenge your memory on how the "NCIS" saga began.  "Gear up" and good luck.
info.name: "NCIS", "Yankee White" - The Beginning Quiz
info.author: MaceoMack

questions.text: In this episode, who or what was "Yankee White"?

answers.text: codename for the President of the United States
answers.value: codename for the President of the United States

answers.text: name of a BBQ rib restaurant in San Antonio, TX
answers.value: name of a BBQ rib restaurant in San Antonio, TX

response.info: A Category One Yankee White clearance is required for over 20 sensitive positions including Presidential Military Aides, the Director and staff of the White House Medical Unit, White House food handlers, chefs, and mess staff, Presidential pilots and flight crews on Air Force One (plane) and Marine One (helicopter), the White House Chief of Staff, and members of the Cabinet.

questions.text: Which regular character was not featured in the episode "Yankee White"?

response.info: Sean Murray is the real-life stepson of series creator Donald P. Bellisario.  Murray's mother, Vivienne is the fourth wife of Donald Bellisario, and appeared several times during seasons one and two as the mysterious red head driving the silver Mercedes who often picked up or delivered Agent Gibbs to or from crime scenes.  Murray's step sister, Troian Bellisario appeared as McGee's younger sister Sarah, in three episodes  "Red Cell" (2:20), "Family Secrets" (3:16), and "Twisted Sister" (4:9), while step-brother Michael Bellisario appeared in the recurring role during season three as Charles "Chip" Sterling, Abby's deranged lab assistant.

questions.text: Which federal agency was not involved in the dispute for jurisdiction of the crime scene?

response.info: As the victim of the incident was a naval officer, Naval Criminal Investigative Service (NCIS) believed they should have primary responsibility for conducting the investigation.

questions.text: When Gibbs and his MCRT (Major Case Response Team) initially approached the security officer at the departure airport terminal, by what name or term did he identify himself and his team as?

response.info: The security officer inquired as to which agency they were a part of.  DiNozzo responded, "NCIS".  The security guard, apparently unfamiliar with NCIS  ask, "Is that anything like CSI?"  DiNozzo answered, without skipping a beat, "Only if you're dyslexic".

questions.text: What was the primary job responsibility of the suspected homicide victim on the day of his death?

response.info: The job of carrying the "Football" is shared jointly by each of the five armed military forces, who rotate the duty.

questions.text: What was the location or designated call sign for the scene of the crime being investigated?

response.info: The two U.S. Air Force custom built planes that primarily service the president actually go by the designation SAM and not AF as indicated in the episode.  Without the president aboard, the designation SAM (Special Air Mission) with the tail number is used.  Either plane that carries the president is designated Air Force One for the time that the president is a passenger.

answers.text: a generous donation to Elmo's favorite charity
answers.value: a generous donation to Elmo's favorite charity

response.info: Steve Bridges passed away in Los Angeles, California on March 2, 2013, at the age of 49.

response.info: Rule #3:  "Do not believe what you are told, double check".

info.description: Exploding crypts, carved up bodies, and a determined Army Colonel. All in a day's work for Special Agent Gibbs!
info.name: "NCIS" Episode: "Skeletons" Trivia Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: What is it about candy bars that Abby hates?

response.info: Abby has an apparent hatred of nougat. Ziva is puzzled by this comment because she doesn't even know what it is. Gibbs is quick to tell her that it's a cream made out of honey, nuts, and sugar.

questions.text: According to Ducky, what made the crypts blow up?

response.info: Ducky mentions this after he sees the remains of the decomposed body on the floor. This is perhaps one of the most gross crime scenes shown on the show. Kudos to the crew who designed the crime scene.

questions.text: What type of flowers did Len Grady have when he came to visit the crime scene?
How does Tony gain access to the Dalton crypt?

response.info: Natalie refuses to sign the forms without having an attorney check them over first. When Tony mentions that they will get a warrant if she refuses, she tells him that getting a warrant would be easier on her. Ziva and McGee are quick to tell Tony that she might have signed the form had he flirted with her a little.

questions.text: Based on the body parts that the team found, how many victims were found?

response.info: The team found 5 bodies. There were 3 women and 2 men. Three were white, 1 was Asian, and 1 was black. One was shot, one was bludgeoned, one was stabbed, one was drowned, and one was strangled. An additional victim was found in Len Grady's van at the end of the episode, bringing the total to 6.

questions.text: What was Tony's reason for believing that Gibbs was not dating or had not previously dated Colonel Mann?

response.info: All of Gibbs' previous relationships have been redheads. Tony seemed to think that Gibbs would not break this streak. He was wrong. Mann became closer to Jethro than any woman in recent history, with the possible exception of Jenny Shepard.

questions.text: How tall does Abby say she is WITHOUT her three inch platform shoes on?

response.info: She claims to be 5'10" without shoes. In this episode, her boyfriend has dumped her because she's too big. Because of this, she is wondering why she always wears such tall shoes.

questions.text: What type of food does the team find in Len Grady's freezer?
When first apprehended, what crime did Len Grady think he was in trouble for committing?

answers.text: cashing his mom's Social Security checks
answers.value: cashing his mom's Social Security checks

answers.text: hit and run in his work van
answers.value: hit and run in his work van

response.correct: cashing his mom's Social Security checks
response.info: Len thought he was in trouble for cashing his mom's Social Security checks. Gibbs was quick to inform his that NCIS is not the IRS and that fraud is the least of his worries.

questions.text: Finish this Colonel Mann quote: "One man is a psychopath, two is a ___________."

response.info: According to Mann, 2 people make a conspiracy. The team knew that more than one person was in on this murder because Len showed up at the crime scene at the same time Colonel Mann did. This means that he found out about it as quickly as she did. They traced his source back to Natalie.

questions.text: What does McGee initially think caused the explosion that killed Commander Dornan?

answers.text: a malfunction in the oxygen system
answers.value: a malfunction in the oxygen system

response.info: McGee and Abby are the only two team members that have any sort of belief in spontaneous human combustion. Apparently, Abby wrote her Master's thesis on the topic.

questions.text: What procedure did Dr. Byers perform on Commander Dornan?

response.info: Commander Dornan was complaining of chest pains while on assignment. He was sent to Bethesda Navy Hospital where Dr. Byers performed an aortic repair to treat acquired aortic stenosis.

questions.text: What problem did Abby find with the medical equipment in Commander Dornan's hospital room?

response.info: Abby, along with the hospital engineers, checked out all of the equipment and found it all to be working properly. This finding supported the notion of foul play, not a freak accident.

questions.text: After showing the team a computer reenactment of the explosion, how does Abby refer to the victim when telling Gibbs that he was murdered?

response.info: Abby refers to Commander Dornan as barbecue boy. By the looks of his remains, this was an accurate description, his chest area was totally charred.

questions.text: Other than the main characters, which other NCIS agent makes an appearance in this episode?

response.info: Special Agent Paula Cassidy makes another appearance in this episode. All three of the other characters appear later in the series.

questions.text: What did the Chief say was the reason that Commander Dornan was so tough on Ensign Hayes?

answers.text: Ensign Hayes was always seeking attention
answers.value: Ensign Hayes was always seeking attention

answers.value: Hayes' father, Captain Hayes, was Dornan's overbearing CO when he was a junior officer

answers.value: He was trying to boost Hayes' confidence

answers.value: He was trying to teach give him a better work ethic

questions.text: How does Ensign Hayes die?

answers.text: he was murdered by the real killer
answers.value: he was murdered by the real killer

response.info: Hayes did not have to nerve to take this own life. Instead, he positioned his weapon to make it look like he was going to shot Gibbs. Even though he had no intention of doing so, Kate had to take the kill shot to protect her partner, Gibbs.

questions.text: Who dunn it? (That is, who committed the murder?)

response.info: This one should be easy. Dr. Byers botched the surgery that lead to the Commander's death. The explosion was only a cover up to prevent another malpractice suit.

questions.text: What brand of bike are the murderers riding?

response.info: The Yamaha logo is shown in the opening of the episode when the murderer puts the kick stand down as he gets off the bike to make sure his victims are dead. The brand is also mentioned when Gibbs asks Abby for an analysis of the tire tracks left by the bike.

questions.text: Kirkland was the name of the Navy man in the back of the taxi. People addressed him as simply admiral, but specifically what type of admiral was he?

response.info: According to the Marine Corps Dictionary, "The current admiral ranks (from junior to most senior) are: Rear Admiral (lower half), one star; Rear Admiral (upper half), two stars; Vice Admiral, three stars; Admiral, four stars and Fleet Admiral, five stars." When the team is briefing Gibbs about Kikland's personal information, they mention his rank as Rear Admiral.

questions.text: In the taxi, what classification were the papers in Kirkland's folder?
What bad luck this Admiral has. Had he not been in that cab he would still be alive. Why exactly was he in that cab?

answers.text: He was unable to get a government vehicle because the computers at the motor pool were down.
answers.value: He was unable to get a government vehicle because the computers at the motor pool were down.

answers.text: His aide wrecked the government vehicle.
answers.value: His aide wrecked the government vehicle.

answers.text: He took the cab because he didn't know how to get to where he was going.
answers.value: He took the cab because he didn't know how to get to where he was going.

response.info: While Kirkland was on his cell phone, he mentions that his car had broken down, so he had to call a cab. He also tells whoever he's on the phone with to go ahead and start their presentation without him.

questions.text: At the crime scene, Jethro tells McGee, "Good for you, just don't ever get married." What prompts Jethro to make this comment?

answers.text: He smells a woman's perfume on him.
answers.value: He smells a woman's perfume on him.

answers.text: He sees McGee blush as he talks on the phone.
answers.value: He sees McGee blush as he talks on the phone.

answers.text: He reads a text message from McGee's new girlfriend.
answers.value: He reads a text message from McGee's new girlfriend.

answers.text: He notices lipstick on McGee's shirt.
answers.value: He notices lipstick on McGee's shirt.

response.correct: He notices lipstick on McGee's shirt.
response.info: When Gibbs sees the lipstick on McGee's shirt, McGee is sure that he's in trouble. To his surprise, Gibbs encourages him, but warns him of the dangers of marriage.

questions.text: While talking to Ducky about the dead cab driver, Gibbs mentions the two best methods of identifying a dead body. Fingerprints are the first. What is the second method he mentioned?

answers.text: DNA from a bone marrow sample
answers.value: DNA from a bone marrow sample

answers.text: DNA from a tooth's root pulp
answers.value: DNA from a tooth's root pulp

response.correct: DNA from a tooth's root pulp
response.info: If you remember, the murderers pulled out a tooth from their victim. This allowed them to use the root pulp DNA to determine if they got the right man.

questions.text: In this episode, Tony gives Ziva grief over her use of the English language. What does Tony say that Ziva never uses?

response.info: After informing her that she never uses contractions and telling her to assimilate, she asks him, "What are contraptions?"

questions.text: In this episode, McGee has a crazy new girlfriend. She opens his mail, gets his credit card numbers, and then maxes out all of his credit cards. To compensate McGee for the charges, the girl's dad sends McGee a check. How much was the check for?
When Abby learned of the crazy girlfriend's actions, where did she tell McGee he should throw her?

response.info: Abby tells McGee to throw her butt in the brig. Abby always seems to get a bit jealous whenever McGee has a new woman in his life.

questions.text: In the autopsy lab, how did Zada know that the man on the table was not her husband, Tomas?

answers.text: his eyes were too far apart
answers.value: his eyes were too far apart

response.info: At first, Ducky only showed Zada the man's head. Just by looking at his face, she knew that it was not Tomas. Just to make sure, she asked Ducky if she could see his body. According to Zada, her husband had scars. The man on the table had no scars.

info.description: How about a new "NCIS" quiz? See this episode? Take this quiz and see how much you remember!
info.name: "NCIS": Episode "Suspicion" Trivia Quiz
info.author: TRNchick

questions.text: At the very beginning of the episode, we see an old man in a bath towel discover blood running out of the door of a motel room. What room number was the victim in?

response.info: The old man was in room number 2. When he locked himself out, he knocked on the door of room 1 wanting the occupant to call the front desk to come let him in. When he looked down, the door mat he was standing on was soaked in blood. Just as a note, when Gibbs was talking to the local LEOs about the crime scene, one of them mentions room 8. If you watch the opening scene, however, the number 1 is clearly shown on the top of the door.

questions.text: As the team enters the squad room for the beginning of the work day, Ziva and Tony are giving McGee grief about the success of his book "Deep Six". What type of car did they say McGee bought with the money he made off of the book?

response.info: Among the other things they make fun of McGee for, the bugged him about buying a Porsche. McGee told them he didn't tell them he was writing a book because they would have made fun of him.

questions.text: In what small town did most of this episode take place?
What is the name of Mr. Tariq's nosy neighbor?

response.info: The nosy neighbor was Darryl Hardy. He aided in Gibbs' investigation by providing photos of the other Iraqi men that Tariq was seen talking to.

questions.text: In Tariq's garage, Ziva finds a liquid on the floor. She swabs the liquid and it tests positive for what substance?

response.info: The swab tests for explosive residue. Ziva specifically stated that it was positive for nitrates. When Ziva sprayed the sample with the indicator spray, the sample changed colors from green to red.

questions.text: Towards the end of the episode, Gibbs' suspects Deputy Tyler Barrett of setting up Tariq. He is asked to remove his pants to have them tested for explosive residue. He initially refuses. Gibbs tells him: "I could have _________   __________ take them off for you!"

response.info: Earlier in this episode, Ziva was crushing the pressure point on the thumb of this deputy for making fun of Tariq's religious beliefs. She made him apologize before she would let him go. If she had to take his pants off, you could guarantee it would not be a pleasurable experience.

questions.text: What color finger print powder does the Edenvale forensic scientist use?

response.info: She uses red florescent powder. This red powder helps McGee discover that Tariq was set up by Tyler Barrett.

questions.text: The Edenvale forensic scientist tells McGee that the best place to swab for explosive residue is where?

answers.text: around the zipper of the pants
answers.value: around the zipper of the pants

answers.text: around the waist band of the pants
answers.value: around the waist band of the pants

answers.text: along the inner seam of the pants
answers.value: along the inner seam of the pants

questions.text: Abby and Dr. Mallard initially thought that there were 2 guns and 2 shooters because of the different velocities of the 2 bullets. Edenvale's forensic scientist proves them wrong. She found that only one weapon was used. The first bullet misfired and stayed in the barrel. When the trigger was pulled again, the second bullet fired normally. This caused both bullets to leave the gun in _________.

response.info: Abby mentions that she's surprised that the barrel didn't explode. The Edenvale forensic scientist thought that it probably did explode. At the end of the episode, the victim's CO was thought to be guilty of the murder. When asked to remove his gloves, he had burn marks on his hands that would be similar to the wounds suffered from an exploding gun barrel.

questions.text: I've asked a lot of questions about Edenvale's forensic scientist. I haven't been calling her that because I forgot her name. I've been waiting to ask you what her name was. What was this red head's name?

response.info: Her name was Ruby. I tried to give you a hint by mentioning that she had red hair. She and McGee seem to have a friendship budding in this episode. It seems that he has a thing for forensic chicks! :)

info.description: From season one to season six, in which episode did the specified event happen?

questions.text: In which two episodes does Tony attempt the Tommy Lee monologue from "The Fugitive"?

response.info: "Corporal Punishment" is from season five. They are chasing Cpl. Damon Werth, a Marine suffering PTSD (and more) who escaped from the hospital.

questions.text: In which episode is Ducky sent undercover to meet La Grenouille?

response.info: Ducky goes undercover as Charles Harrow, a Navy code-maker in order to draw Mr Froggie into the open. The plan gets all messed up by Trent Kort, but Ducky has fun anyways.

questions.text: In which episode do Gibbs, Tony, and Caitlin travel to Colombia?

questions.text: In which episode do we meet Jackson Gibbs (and Gibbs' beautiful car)?

questions.text: In which episode does the gang trade boats with a gang of Russian pirates?

response.info: It's the 100th episode.

questions.text: In which episode does McGee bring his comically large coffee cup?

response.info: Tony wonders if he's the only normal one there.

questions.text: In which episode do we meet Chip Sterling?
In which episode (excluding flashbacks) do we meet Mike Franks?

response.info: When Jenny calls him for help, he laughs at her. Michael refuses to return until she mentions Jethro's name, then he's on the next flight.

questions.text: In which episode does Abby dress up like Marilyn Monroe?

response.info: It's her Halloween costume. The boys drool a lot.

questions.text: What was Tony and Kate's doctor's name?

questions.text: Gibbs told Jimmy to requisition what items for the team?
The plague that had infected Tony had a suicide gene to make it die in how many hours?

questions.text: Cassie was whose Probie?

info.description: For hardcore "NCIS" fans: Information on season 1, episode 2.
info.name: "NCIS"- Season 1, Episode 2 Trivia Quiz
info.author: wmucker93

questions.text: What is the title of this episode?

response.info: This episode is titled "Hung Out to Dry" most likely because it is about a Marine paratrooper who was found impaled in the roof of an SUV.

questions.text: Who was the victim?

response.info: Sgt. Fuentas fell through the roof of an SUV while parachuting.

questions.text: What was the victim's nickname?
What was in the package that Gibbs received at Quantico Marine Corps Base?

response.info: Ducky sent him a cell phone, because on that day every year his third ex-wife calls him up drunk.

questions.text: What does Abby relate Tony to?

response.info: When Tony asked why Abby didn't take to him as fast as she did Kate, Abby says "You're like a piercing Tony. It takes a while for the throbbing to stop and the skin to grow back."

questions.text: What "JAG" character appeared in this episode?

response.info: Agent Gibbs interrogates him to try to persuade him to give them some legal "leeway".

questions.text: What does Gibbs say is "scuttlebutt"?

response.info: Gibbs explained to Kate that scuttlebutt is Marine terminology for water cooler gossip.

questions.text: Who signs up to train to parachute?
How did Tony say he got into NCIS?

response.info: When walking in Quantico, Kate asks Tony how he got into NCIS and he replies, "I smiled".

questions.text: What did they find in Corporal Ramsy's locker that suggested he committed the murder?

response.info: When searching the locker Kate found the salt which contained sulfuric acid which was found on the frayed parachute chords.

questions.text: What number was on Sergeant Fuentas' real reserve parachute?

response.info: When finding his real reserve chute, Abby notices unlucky number 13.

questions.text: In what country does Tony say the number 4 is unlucky in?
Who was behind the murder?

response.info: Since Dafelmair was first at the scene, he switched his reserve with the dirty reserve so that it looked as if Sergeant Fuentas was late to pull it.

questions.text: Who falls out of the plane?

response.info: While reading Dafelmair his rights, another Marine attacks Dafelmair, knocking DiNozzo out of the plane.

questions.text: What is Gibbs seen doing at the end of this episode?

response.info: Gibbs is seen finishing the unfinished treehouse of the victim's son.

questions.text: What is the title of this episode?

response.info: "Seadog" was the nickname of the victim, given to him by the members of his charity group. Hense the title "Seadog".

questions.text: What does Gibbs say Ducky did to a French police officer?

answers.text: ran his cruiser off the road
answers.value: ran his cruiser off the road

response.info: While complaining about the poor experience of Sergeant Lynn, Gibbs mentioned about when Ducky once shoved a French cop off a cliff.

questions.text: What was the name of the victim?
What was the name of the news reporter at the crime scene?

response.info: Diane Fontaine was the news reporter seen at the crime scene and had to be escourted from the scene by DiNozzo.

questions.text: What was found in the drug dealer's fanny pack?

response.info: While searching the corpse Gibbs found money in the victim's fanny pack and then wondered why drug dealers would leave the money behind.

questions.text: What was the name of the Commander's boat?

response.info: While talking about the witnesses' statements Kate mentioned how the Mary-Celeste crashed onto the shoreline.

questions.text: What gun was used in the murder?

response.info: Abby signed to Gibbs in her lab that she had found a match to the AK-47 round found in Commander Ferrell.

questions.text: What did Tony sign in the elevator?
What was the name of the drug lord's boat?

response.info: At the beginning of the scene where Gibbs and DiNozzo search the drug lord's boat you clearly see the name at the back of the boat.

questions.text: What were the names of the two Australian girls at the marina?

response.info: Jenny and Nancy were two Australian girls who happened to see the murderer and his partner exiting the boat.

questions.text: Who was behind the murders?

response.info: Seth Shakir was a known terrorist who was under surveillance by the FBI.

questions.text: What was the company name on the van used by the terrorists?
What were the terrorists' intentions?

response.info: They were intending to knock out three nodes simultaneously to cause a cascading blackout.

questions.text: Which of the following was NOT one of the targets?

response.info: On the terrorist's computer screen you can see the three targets and Morrisville was not one of them.

questions.text: How many numbers did the terrorist dial before he was killed?

response.info: While under attack by the three special agents the terrorist tried to make one final stand by blowing the nodes but was killed shortly before he could detonate it.

questions.text: What is the name of the ship that Gibbs, Ducky, and the rest of the team have to board to conduct a murder investigation?

response.info: The Chimera is a top secret Naval ship.

questions.text: Who is the commander of the Chimera?

response.info: Commander Skinner took a real interest in Director Shepard.

questions.text: What band does Abby want Ziva, Tony and Mcgee to see with her?
What does McGee say to Abby as he gives her back her concert ticket?

answers.text: "I'll try and go with you a different time."
answers.value: "I'll try and go with you a different time."

answers.text: "I think a crime scene is more important than a concert.  Sorry."
answers.value: "I think a crime scene is more important than a concert.  Sorry."

response.info: McGee never had the best jokes in the world, according to DiNozzo.

questions.text: How does Tony supposedly get hemorrhagic fever?

answers.text: touching a dead body that had hemorrhagic fever
answers.value: touching a dead body that had hemorrhagic fever

answers.value: drinking a glass of water that they discovered had bacteria from Hemorrhagic Fever

response.info: Abby warned Tony not to inhale the blood right after he inhales it.

questions.text: What phobia does Ziva have that you learn about in this episode?

response.info: In this episode, Ziva says, "In Mossad part of the training is to be open to things you can not see, or even understand."

questions.text: When Ziva opens the door to the electrical room, the ship's cook runs out but Ziva catches him.  Who else did Gibbs, Tony, Ziva and Mcgee catch aboard the ship?

response.info: The communications officer, Lieutenant Ferris, tries killing Tony by causing a cargo box to drop on Tony's head.  Tony jumps out of the way just in time.

questions.text: How did Gibbs and the team get away from the marauders that ambushed the Chimera?

answers.text: Killed them all and steered the ship back to shore
answers.value: Killed them all and steered the ship back to shore

questions.text: What are the marauders really after?

response.info: That is how they figure out they are not marauders, but Russians on a Russian black-ops mission.

questions.text: What happens to the Chimera as Gibbs and the team are on the Russians' boat fleeing the Chimera?

response.info: When the Navy launched a missile at the Chimera, the Navy did not know Gibbs and his team were off the ship yet.

info.name: "NCIS"- Season 1, Episode 7 Trivia Quiz
info.author: wmucker93

questions.text: What is the title of this episode?

response.info: Although the name of the submarine that most of the episode was taken place on wasn't Rosa, the title of this episode is "Sub Rosa".

questions.text: What was in the barrel that the body was found in?

response.info: While examining the body at the scene Ducky says how there are multiple purposes for hydrofluoric acid on a Naval base.

questions.text: Who accompanies the team to the crime scene?
What were the people outside the base protesting?

response.info: The protesters were holding up picket signs that were protesting submarine sonars that were killing whales.

questions.text: What city is the submarine they board named after?

response.info: The team narrows it down to the Philadelphia. That was the most likely of a submarine for an impostor to get on.

questions.text: What type of vodka is to be won over in the war game?

response.info: While Gibbs was talking to the captain about aborting the war game the captain says that he has a bottle of Stoli riding on the game. Stolichnaya is also know as Stoli.

questions.text: How do Tony and Timothy get into the suspect's house?

response.info: Although it was against the law without a warrant, Tony throws a rock through the front door's window and enters the suspect's house.

questions.text: What type of water is seen throughout this episode?
What was the screensaver on the suspect's computer?

response.info: Before examining the suspect's computer they see the screensaver. Then DiNozzo says, "I guess flying toasters would be too much to ask for".

questions.text: What type of gas was the eco-terrorist going to set off on the ship?

response.info: While searching the suspect's computer files DiNozzo and McGee find the chemical compound of isopropyl methylphosphonofluoridate a.k.a. sarin gas.

questions.text: Who was the victim?

response.info: Abby finds out that she couldn't match the victim's picture because he missed his crew picture and she then finds his picture on the crew's newsletter.

questions.text: Who was the impostor?
How much faster was the sub when it was submerged?

response.info: Kate asks the captain why they were going back down and then the captain states that they are 15 knots faster submerged.

questions.text: Which of the following was NOT one of the types of ice cream given to Kate and Gibbs?

response.info: The crew had to empty the freezer for room for the body and they gave Gibbs and Kate a choice between rocky road, pumpkin, cookies 'n cream, butter pecan, and chocolate.

questions.text: What torpedo tube was used to dispose of the body?

response.info: Because of the threat of sarin gas they had to dispose the body via torpedo tube, but 2,3, and 4 were taken and they had to use tube 1.
